field.name: CYCLE_NUM
field.description: cmd clock cycles

field.name: DIR3
field.description: No description available

field.name: AD_SEL3
field.description: No description available

field.name: BYTE_SEL3
field.description: No description available

field.name: DIR2
field.description: No description available

field.name: AD_SEL2
field.description: No description available

field.name: BYTE_SEL2
field.description: No description available

field.name: DIR1
field.description: No description available

field.name: AD_SEL1
field.description: No description available

field.name: BYTE_SEL1
field.description: No description available

field.name: DIR0
field.description: 0 for OUT; 1 for IN

field.name: AD_SEL0
field.description: 0 for data; 1 for address.

field.name: BYTE_SEL0
field.description: select one of the 4 bytes(11 for 31:24, 10 for 23:16, 01 for 15:8, 00 for 7:0)

field.name: IO_CFG7
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG6
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG5
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG4
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG3
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG2
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG1
field.description: No description available

field.name: IO_CFG0
field.description: for OUT, it defines the output value(0 or 1); for IN, it defines whether to wait for ready(ready polarity is defined in ctrl_pad_pol)

field.name: LOCK
field.description: lock fields in this register, lock can only be cleared by soc reset 0: fields can be changed 1: fields locked to current value, not changeable

field.name: HIDE
field.description: pin value visibility to gpios, bit0: 1, invisible to soc gpio0; 0: visible to soc gpio0 bit1: 1, invisible to soc gpio1; 0: visible to soc gpio1 bit2: 1, invisible to cpu0 fast gpio; 0: visible to cpu0 fast gpio bit3: 1, invisible to cpu1 fast gpio; 0: visible to cpu1 fast gpio

field.name: SELECT
RUN
field.description: Run control. 0 LOBS disabled. Register programming permitted. 1 LOBS enabled

field.name: SEL
field.description: Signal Group Select 0 128bit from one group 1 from 2 groups, 4bit in each group

field.name: FULL_CLEAR
field.description: FIFO Overflow Clear

field.name: SAMPLE
field.description: Sample Rate 4 take one every 5 5 take one every 6 6 take one every 7

field.name: BURST
field.description: Burst Cfg 3b011 Incr4 3b101 Incr8 3b111 Incr16

field.name: TRACE
field.description: Enables trace

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Start address

field.name: ADDR
field.description: End address

field.name: FINALSTATE
field.description: 0 LOBS is still tracing. 1 Indicates that the LOBS has stopped advancing Trigger States and stopped trace. FINALSTATE can be set by TRIGCTRL.COUNTBRK reaching the final loop count, or by programming NEXTSTATEto zero

field.name: CTSR
field.description: Reads current Trigger State. This is a one-hot encoded field. When CTRL.RUN: 0 RAZ. 1 Returns current Trigger State. If FINALSTATE is 1, then the CTSR field gives the Trigger State when FINALSTATE became 1

field.name: CCVR
field.description: Returns the counter value when the CTSR was last read. If the CTSR has never been read, then the value in the CCVR is undefined

field.name: TRACE
field.description: Trace active. 0b0 Trace is not active. 0b1 Trace is active.

field.name: FULL
field.description: FIFO full

field.name: EMPTY
field.description: FIFO empty

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Final address

field.name: NUM2
field.description: Select sample group number2

field.name: NUM1
field.description: Select sample group number1

field.name: EN2
field.description: Enable sample group number2

field.name: EN1
field.description: Enable sample group number1

field.name: NUM4
field.description: Select sample signal bit number4 in first group

field.name: NUM3
field.description: Select sample signal bit number3 in first group

field.name: NUM2
field.description: Select sample signal bit number2 in first group

field.name: NUM1
field.description: Select sample signal bit number1 in first group

field.name: NUM4
field.description: Select sample signal bit number4 in second group

field.name: NUM3
field.description: Select sample signal bit number3 in second group

field.name: NUM2
field.description: Select sample signal bit number2 in second group

field.name: NUM1
field.description: Select sample signal bit number1 in second group

field.name: EN2
field.description: Enable sample signal number2

field.name: EN1
field.description: Enable sample signal number1

field.name: EN
field.description: Selects Signal Group. 0x1 Selects Signal Group 0. 0x2 Selects Signal Group 1. 0x4 Selects Signal Group 2. 0x8 Selects Signal Group 3. 0x10 Selects Signal Group 4. 0x20 Selects Signal Group 5. 0x40 Selects Signal Group 6. 0x80 Selects Signal Group 7. 0x100 Selects Signal Group 8. 0x200 Selects Signal Group 9. 0x400 Selects Signal Group 10. 0x800 Selects Signal Group 11.

field.name: TRACE
field.description: Trace capture control. 0b10 Trace is captured every ELACLK cycle. others Reserved.

field.name: COMPSEL
field.description: Comparison mode. Acts as both a counter enable and a select for the comparison mode. 0b0 Disable counters and select Trigger Signal Comparison mode. 0b1 Enable counters and select Trigger Counter Comparison mode.

field.name: COMP
field.description: Trigger Signal Comparison type select. 0b000 Trigger Signal Comparisons disabled. The enabled counters count clocks immediately after the Trigger State has been entered and generate a programmable Output Action and transition to the next Trigger State when the Counter Compare Register count is reached, that is when a Trigger Counter Comparison match occurs. 0b001 Compare type is equal (==). 0b010 Compare type is greater than (>). 0b011 Compare type is greater than or equal (>=). 0b101 Compare type is not equal (!=). 0b110 Compare type is less than (<). 0b111 Compare type is less than or equal (<=).

field.name: NEXTSTATE
field.description: Selects the next state to move to after the Trigger Condition has been met in the current state. 0x0 Do not change state. This is the final Trigger State. 0x1 Selects Trigger State 0. 0x2 Selects Trigger State 1. 0x4 Selects Trigger State 2. 0x8 Selects Trigger State 3. 0x10 Selects Trigger State 4.

field.name: TRACE
field.description: Trace active. 0b0 Trace disable. 0b1 Trace enable.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: A value that, when reached in the associated up-counter for this Trigger State, causes a Trigger Counter Comparison match to occur.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: External Mask

field.name: VALUE
field.description: External Compare

field.name: NUM3
field.description: Select compare signal number3

field.name: NUM2
field.description: Select compare signal number2

field.name: NUM1
field.description: Select compare signal number1

field.name: NUM0
field.description: Select compare signal number0

field.name: EN
field.description: Select compare signal number0-3

field.name: VALUE0
field.description: Compare golden value for Signal Group signals[31:0].

field.name: VALUE1
field.description: Compare golden value for Signal Group signals[63:32].

field.name: VALUE2
field.description: Compare golden value for Signal Group signals[95:64].

field.name: VALUE3
field.description: Compare golden value for Signal Group signals[127:96].

field.name: VALUE
field.description: Lock Access Value

field.name: TRIG_LEN
field.description: length for current trigger, can up to 4 conversions for one trigger, from 0 to 3

field.name: INTEN3
field.description: interrupt enable for 4th conversion

field.name: CHAN3
field.description: channel number for 4th conversion

field.name: INTEN2
field.description: interrupt enable for 3rd conversion

field.name: CHAN2
field.description: channel number for 3rd conversion

field.name: INTEN1
field.description: interrupt enable for 2nd conversion

field.name: CHAN1
field.description: channel number for 2nd conversion

field.name: QUEUE_EN
field.description: preemption queue enable control

field.name: INTEN0
field.description: interrupt enable for 1st conversion

field.name: CHAN0
field.description: channel number for 1st conversion

field.name: TRG_DMA_ADDR
field.description: buffer start address for trigger queue, 192byte total, 16 bytes for each trigger (4 bytes for each conversion)

field.name: TRG_SW_STA
field.description: SW trigger start bit, HW will clear it after all conversions(up to 4) finished. SW should make sure it's 0 before set it.

field.name: TRIG_SW_INDEX
field.description: which trigger for the SW trigger 0 for trig0a, 1 for trig0b 3 for trig1a, 11 for trig3c

field.name: VALID
field.description: set after conversion finished if wait_dis is set, cleared after software read. The first time read with 0 will trigger one new conversion. If SW read other channel when one channel conversion is in progress, it will not trigger new conversion at other channel, and will get old result with valid 0, also with read_cflct interrupt status bit set. the result may not realtime if software read once and wait long time to read again

field.name: CHAN_RESULT
field.description: read this register will trigger one adc conversion. If wait_dis bit is set, SW will get the latest conversion result(not current one) with valid bit is 0, SW need polling valid bit till it's set to get current result If wait_dis bit is 0, SW can get the current conversion result with holding the bus, valid bit is always set at this mode. this is not recommended if channel sample time is too long

field.name: BUS_MODE_EN
field.description: bus mode enable

field.name: WAIT_DIS
field.description: set to disable read waiting, get result immediately but maybe not current conversion result.

field.name: CYCLE
field.description: current dma write cycle bit

field.name: SEQ_LEN
field.description: sequence queue length, 0 for one, 0xF for 16

field.name: RESTART_EN
field.description: if set together with cont_en, HW will continue process the whole queue after trigger once. If cont_en is 0, this bit is not used

field.name: CONT_EN
field.description: if set, HW will continue process the queue till end(seq_len) after trigger once

field.name: SW_TRIG
field.description: SW trigger, pulse signal, cleared by HW one cycle later

field.name: SW_TRIG_EN
field.description: set to enable SW trigger

field.name: HW_TRIG_EN
field.description: set to enable external HW trigger, only trigger on posedge

field.name: TAR_ADDR
field.description: dma target address, should be 4-byte aligned

field.name: SEQ_WR_POINTER
field.description: HW update this field after each dma write, it indicate the next dma write pointer. dma write address is (tar_addr+seq_wr_pointer)*4

field.name: STOP_POS
field.description: if stop_en is set, SW is responsible to update this field to the next read point, HW should not write data to this point since it's not read out by SW yet

field.name: DMA_RST
field.description: set this bit will reset HW dma write pointer to seq_dma_addr, and set HW cycle bit to 1. dma is halted if this bit is set. SW should clear all cycle bit in buffer to 0 before clear dma_rst

field.name: STOP_EN
field.description: set to stop dma if reach the stop_pos

field.name: BUF_LEN
SEQ_INT_EN
field.description: interrupt enable for current conversion

field.name: CHAN_NUM_4_0
field.description: channel number for current conversion

field.name: STOP_POS_HIGH
field.description: No description available

field.name: BUF_LEN_HIGH
field.description: No description available

field.name: PRD
field.description: conver period, with prescale. Set to 0 means disable current channel

field.name: THSHDH
field.description: threshold high, assert interrupt(if enabled) if result exceed high or low.

field.name: THSHDL
field.description: threshold low

field.name: CHAN_RESULT
field.description: adc convert result, update after each valid conversion. it may be updated period according to config, also may be updated due to other queue convert the same channel

field.name: SAMPLE_CLOCK_NUMBER_SHIFT
field.description: shift for sample clock number

field.name: SAMPLE_CLOCK_NUMBER
field.description: sample clock number, base on clock_period, default one period

field.name: CONVERT_CLOCK_NUMBER
CLOCK_DIVIDER
field.description: clock_period, N half clock cycle per half adc cycle 0 for same adc_clk and bus_clk, 1 for 1:2, 2 for 1:3, ... 15 for 1:16 Note: set to 2 can genenerate 66.7MHz adc_clk at 200MHz bus_clk

field.name: SEL_SYNC_AHB
field.description: set to 1 will enable sync AHB bus, to get better bus performance. Adc_clk must to be set to same as bus clock at this mode

field.name: ADC_AHB_EN
field.description: set to 1 to enable ADC DMA to write data to soc memory bus, for trig queue and seq queue;

field.name: PORT3_REALTIME
field.description: set to enable trg queue stop other queues

field.name: TRIG_CMPT
field.description: interrupt for one trigger conversion complete if enabled

field.name: TRIG_SW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: TRIG_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: READ_CFLCT
field.description: read conflict interrupt, set if wait_dis is set, one conversion is in progress, SW read another channel

field.name: SEQ_SW_CFLCT
field.description: sequence queue conflict interrupt, set if HW or SW trigger received during conversion

field.name: SEQ_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: SEQ_DMAABT
field.description: dma abort interrupt, set if seqence dma write pointer reachs sw read pointer if stop_en is set

field.name: SEQ_CMPT
field.description: the whole sequence complete interrupt

field.name: SEQ_CVC
field.description: one conversion complete in seq_queue if related seq_int_en is set

field.name: DMA_FIFO_FULL
field.description: DMA fifo full interrupt, user need to check clock frequency if it's set.

field.name: AHB_ERR
field.description: set if got hresp=1, generally caused by wrong trg_dma_addr or seq_dma_addr

field.name: STOP_POS
field.description: No description available

field.name: WDOG
field.description: set if one chanel watch dog event triggered

field.name: TRIG_CMPT
field.description: interrupt for one trigger conversion complete if enabled

field.name: TRIG_SW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: TRIG_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: READ_CFLCT
field.description: read conflict interrupt, set if wait_dis is set, one conversion is in progress, SW read another channel

field.name: SEQ_SW_CFLCT
field.description: sequence queue conflict interrupt, set if HW or SW trigger received during conversion

field.name: SEQ_HW_CFLCT
field.description: No description available

field.name: SEQ_DMAABT
field.description: dma abort interrupt, set if seqence dma write pointer reachs sw read pointer if stop_en is set

field.name: SEQ_CMPT
field.description: the whole sequence complete interrupt

field.name: SEQ_CVC
field.description: one conversion complete in seq_queue if related seq_int_en is set

field.name: DMA_FIFO_FULL
field.description: DMA fifo full interrupt, user need to check clock frequency if it's set.

field.name: AHB_ERR
field.description: set if got hresp=1, generally caused by wrong trg_dma_addr or seq_dma_addr

field.name: STOP_POS
field.description: No description available

field.name: WDOG
field.description: set if one chanel watch dog event triggered

field.name: SEQ_CMPT
field.description: No description available

field.name: SEQ_CVC
field.description: No description available

field.name: STOP_POS
field.description: No description available

field.name: WDOG
field.description: No description available

field.name: TRG_CMPT_FLAG
field.description: No description available

field.name: MOTO_EN
field.description: "set to enable moto_soc and moto_valid. Should use AHB clock for adc, this bit can be used avoid async output"

field.name: ADC_CLK_ON
field.description: set to enable adc clock to analog, Software should set this bit before access to any adc16_* register. MUST set clock_period to 0 or 1 for adc16 reg access

field.name: STARTCAL
field.description: set to start the offset calibration cycle (Active H). user need to clear it after setting it.

field.name: CALON
field.description: Indicates if the ADC is in calibration mode (Active H).

field.name: PARAM_VAL
field.description: No description available

field.name: REG_EN
field.description: set to enable regulator

field.name: BANDGAP_EN
field.description: set to enable bandgap. user should set reg_en and bandgap_en before use adc16.

field.name: CAL_AVG_CFG
PREEMPT_EN
field.description: set to enable preemption feature

field.name: CONV_PARAM
field.description: conversion parameter

field.name: COV_END_CNT
field.description: used for faster conversion, user can change it to get higher convert speed(but less accuracy). should set to (21-convert_clock_number+1).

field.name: HYST
field.description: This bitfield configure the comparator hysteresis. 00: Hysteresis level 0 01: Hysteresis level 1 10: Hysteresis level 2 11: Hysteresis level 3

field.name: DACEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator internal DAC 0: DAC disabled 1: DAC enabled

field.name: HPMODE
field.description: This bit enable the comparator high performance mode. 0: HP mode disabled 1: HP mode enabled

field.name: CMPEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator. 0: ACMP disabled 1: ACMP enabled

field.name: MINSEL
field.description: PIN select, from pad_ai_acmp[7:1] and dac_out

field.name: DAC_TRIG_EN
field.description: if set, the dac value is from moto system when valid if clr, use dac_cfg value

field.name: PINSEL
field.description: MIN select, from pad_ai_acmp[7:1] and dac_out

field.name: CMPOEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator output on pad. 0: ACMP output disabled 1: ACMP output enabled

field.name: FLTBYPS
field.description: This bit bypass the comparator output digital filter. 0: The ACMP output need pass digital filter 1: The ACMP output digital filter is bypassed.

field.name: WINEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator window mode. 0: Window mode is disabled 1: Window mode is enabled

field.name: OPOL
field.description: The output polarity control bit. 0: The ACMP output remain un-changed. 1: The ACMP output is inverted.

field.name: FLTMODE
SYNCEN
field.description: This bit enable the comparator output synchronization. 0: ACMP output not synchronized with ACMP clock. 1: ACMP output synchronized with ACMP clock.

field.name: FLTLEN
field.description: This bitfield define the ACMP output digital filter length. The unit is ACMP clock cycle.

field.name: DACCFG
field.description: 8bit DAC digital value output to analog block

field.name: FEDGF
field.description: Output falling edge flag. Write 1 to clear this flag.

field.name: REDGF
field.description: Output rising edge flag. Write 1 to clear this flag.

field.name: FEDGEN
field.description: Output falling edge flag interrupt enable bit.

field.name: REDGEN
field.description: Output rising edge flag interrupt enable bit.

field.name: FEDGEN
field.description: Output falling edge flag DMA request enable bit.

field.name: REDGEN
field.description: Output rising edge flag DMA request enable bit.

field.name: SFTRST_RX
field.description: software reset the RX module if asserted to be 1'b1. Self-clear.

field.name: SFTRST_TX
field.description: software reset the TX module if asserted to be 1'b1. Self-clear.

field.name: SFTRST_CLKGEN
field.description: software reset the CLK GEN module if asserted to be 1'b1. Self-clear.

field.name: TXDNIE
field.description: TX buffer data needed interrupt enable 0: TXE interrupt masked 1: TXE interrupt not masked. Used to generate an interrupt request when the TXE flag is set.

field.name: RXDAIE
field.description: RX buffer data available interrupt enable 0: RXNE interrupt masked 1: RXNE interrupt not masked. Used to generate an interrupt request when the RXNE flag is set.

field.name: ERRIE
field.description: Error interrupt enable This bit controls the generation of an interrupt when an error condition (UD, OV) occurs. 0: Error interrupt is masked 1: Error interrupt is enabled

field.name: TX_DMA_EN
field.description: Asserted to use DMA, else to use interrupt

field.name: RX_DMA_EN
field.description: Asserted to use DMA, else to use interrupt

field.name: TXFIFOCLR
field.description: Self-clear

field.name: RXFIFOCLR
field.description: Self-clear

field.name: TX_EN
field.description: enable for each TX data pad

field.name: RX_EN
field.description: enable for each RX data pad

field.name: I2S_EN
field.description: enable for the module

field.name: RX3
field.description: RX3 fifo fillings

field.name: RX2
field.description: RX2 fifo fillings

field.name: RX1
field.description: RX1 fifo fillings

field.name: RX0
field.description: RX0 fifo fillings

field.name: TX3
field.description: TX3 fifo fillings

field.name: TX2
field.description: TX2 fifo fillings

field.name: TX1
field.description: TX1 fifo fillings

field.name: TX0
field.description: TX0 fifo fillings

field.name: TX
field.description: TX fifo threshold to trigger STA[tx_dn]. When tx fifo filling is smaller than or equal to the threshold, assert the tx_dn flag.

field.name: RX
field.description: RX fifo threshold to trigger STA[rx_da]. When rx fifo filling is greater than or equal to the threshold, assert the rx_da flag.

field.name: TX_UD
field.description: Asserted when tx fifo is underflow. Should be ANDed with CTRL[tx_en] the for correct value. Write 1 to any of these 4 bits will clear the underflow error.

field.name: RX_OV
field.description: Asserted when rx fifo is overflow. Write 1 to any of these 4 bits will clear the overflow error.

field.name: TX_DN
field.description: Asserted when tx fifo data are needed.

field.name: RX_DA
field.description: Asserted when rx fifo data are available.

field.name: D
field.description: No description available

field.name: D
field.description: No description available

field.name: BCLK_GATEOFF
field.description: Gate off the bclk. Asserted to gate-off the BCLK.

field.name: BCLK_DIV
field.description: Linear prescaler to generate BCLK from MCLK. BCLK_DIV [8:0] = 0: BCLK=No CLK. BCLK_DIV [8:0] = 1: BCLK=MCLK/1 BCLK_DIV [8:0] = n: BCLK=MCLK/(n). Note: These bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled. It is used only when the I2S is in master mode.

field.name: INV_BCLK_OUT
field.description: Invert the BCLK before sending it out to pad. Only valid in BCLK master mode

field.name: INV_BCLK_IN
field.description: Invert the BCLK pad input before using it internally. Only valid in BCLK slave mode

field.name: INV_FCLK_OUT
field.description: Invert the FCLK before sending it out to pad. Only valid in FCLK master mode

field.name: INV_FCLK_IN
field.description: Invert the FCLK pad input before using it internally. Only valid in FCLK slave mode

field.name: INV_MCLK_OUT
field.description: Invert the MCLK before sending it out to pad. Only valid in MCLK master mode

field.name: INV_MCLK_IN
field.description: Invert the MCLK pad input before using it internally. Only valid in MCLK slave mode

field.name: BCLK_SEL_OP
field.description: asserted to use external clk source

field.name: FCLK_SEL_OP
field.description: asserted to use external clk source

field.name: MCK_SEL_OP
field.description: asserted to use external clk source

field.name: FRAME_EDGE
field.description: The start edge of a frame 0: Falling edge indicates a new frame (Just like standard I2S Philips standard) 1: Rising edge indicates a new frame

field.name: CH_MAX
field.description: CH_MAX[4:0] s the number of channels supported in TDM mode. When not in TDM mode, it must be set as 2. It must be an even number, so CH_MAX[0] is always 0. 5'h2: 2 channels 5'h4: 4 channels ... 5h10: 16 channels (max)

field.name: TDM_EN
field.description: TDM mode 0: not TDM mode 1: TDM mode

field.name: STD
field.description: I2S standard selection 00: I2S Philips standard. 01: MSB justified standard (left justified) 10: LSB justified standard (right justified) 11: PCM standard Note: For correct operation, these bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled.

field.name: DATSIZ
field.description: Data length to be transferred 00: 16-bit data length 01: 24-bit data length 10: 32-bit data length 11: Not allowed Note: For correct operation, these bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled.

field.name: CHSIZ
field.description: Channel length (number of bits per audio channel) 0: 16-bit wide 1: 32-bit wide The bit write operation has a meaning only if DATSIZ = 00 otherwise the channel length is fixed to 32-bit by hardware whatever the value filled in. Note: For correct operation, this bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled.

field.name: MCLK_GATEOFF
field.description: Gate off the mclk. This mclk is the output of a glitch prone mux, so every time to switch the mclk, the gate off clock should be asserted at first. After the clock is switched, de-assert this bit to ungate off the mclk.

field.name: MCLKOE
field.description: Master clock output to pad enable 0: Master clock output is disabled 1: Master clock output is enabled Note: This bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled. It is used only when the I2S is in master mode.

field.name: EN
field.description: No description available

field.name: EN
field.description: No description available

field.name: HPF_EN
field.description: Whether HPF is enabled. This HPF is used to filter out the DC part.

field.name: MONO
field.description: Asserted to let the left and right channel output the same value.

field.name: RIGHT_EN
field.description: Asserted to enable the right channel

field.name: LEFT_EN
field.description: Asserted to enable the left channel

field.name: REMAP
field.description: 1: Use remap pwm version. The remap version is a version that one pwm output is tied to zero when the input pcm signal is positive or negative 0: Don't use remap pwm version

field.name: INVERT
field.description: all the outputs are inverted before sending to pad

field.name: FALSE_LEVEL
field.description: the pad output in False run mode, or when the module is disabled 0: all low 1: all high 2: P-high, N-low 3. output is not enabled

field.name: FALSE_RUN
field.description: the module continues to consume data, but all the pads are constant, thus no audio out

field.name: SFTRST
field.description: Self-clear

field.name: RUN
field.description: Enable this module to run.

field.name: FRAME_EDGE
field.description: The start edge of a frame 0: Falling edge indicates a new frame (Just like standard I2S Philips standard) 1: Rising edge indicates a new frame

field.name: CH_MAX
field.description: CH_MAX[3:0] is the number if channels supported in TDM mode. When not in TDM mode, it must be set as 2. It must be an even number, so CH_MAX[0] is always 0. 4'h2: 2 channels 4'h4: 4 channels etc

field.name: TDM_EN
field.description: TDM mode 0: not TDM mode 1: TDM mode

field.name: STD
field.description: I2S standard selection 00: I2S Philips standard. 01: MSB justified standard (left justified) 10: LSB justified standard (right justified) 11: PCM standard For more details on I2S standards. Note: For correct operation, these bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled.

field.name: DATSIZ
field.description: Data length to be transferred 00: 16-bit data length 01: 24-bit data length 10: 32-bit data length 11: Not allowed Note: For correct operation, these bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled.

field.name: CHSIZ
field.description: Channel length (number of bits per audio channel) 0: 16-bit wide 1: 32-bit wide The bit write operation has a meaning only if DATLEN = 00 otherwise the channel length is fixed to 32-bit by hardware whatever the value filled in. Note: For correct operation, this bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled.

field.name: EN
field.description: Slot enable for the channels.

field.name: COEF
field.description: Composite value of coef A of the Order-1 HPF

field.name: COEF
field.description: coef B of the Order-1 HPF

field.name: SFTRST
field.description: software reset the module. Self-clear.

field.name: SOF_FEDGE
field.description: asserted if the falling edge of the ref fclk from DAO is the start of a new frame. This is used to to align DAO feedback signal.

field.name: USE_COEF_RAM
field.description: Asserted to use Coef RAM instead of Coef ROM

field.name: FILT_CRX_ERR_IE
field.description: data accessed out of boundary error interruput enable. The error happens when the module cannot calculate the enough number of data in time.

field.name: OFIFO_OVFL_ERR_IE
field.description: output fifo overflow error interrupt enable

field.name: CIC_OVLD_ERR_IE
field.description: CIC overload error interrupt enable

field.name: CIC_SAT_ERR_IE
field.description: Error interrupt enable This bit controls the generation of an interrupt when an error condition (CIC saturation) occurs. 0: Error interrupt is masked 1: Error interrupt is enabled

field.name: DEC_AFT_CIC
field.description: decimation rate after CIC. Now it is forced to be 3.

field.name: CAPT_DLY
field.description: Capture cycle delay>=0, should be less than PDM_CLK_HFDIV

field.name: PDM_CLK_HFDIV
field.description: The clock divider will work at least 4. 0: div-by-2, 1: div-by-4 . . . n: div-by-2*(n+1)

field.name: PDM_CLK_DIV_BYPASS
field.description: asserted to bypass the pdm clock divider

field.name: PDM_CLK_OE
field.description: pdm_clk_output_en

field.name: HPF_EN
field.description: pdm high pass filter enable. This order-1 HPF only applies to the PDM mic data.

field.name: CH_POL
field.description: Asserted to select PDM_CLK high level captured, otherwise to select PDM_CLK low level captured.

field.name: CH_EN
field.description: Asserted to enable the channel. Ch8 & 9 are refs. Ch0-7 are pdm mics.

field.name: FILT_CRX_ERR
field.description: data accessed out of boundary error

field.name: OFIFO_OVFL_ERR
field.description: output fifo overflow error. The reason may be sampling frequency mismatch, either fast or slow.

field.name: CIC_OVLD_ERR
field.description: CIC overload error. write 1 clear

field.name: CIC_SAT_ERR
field.description: CIC saturation. Write 1 clear

field.name: CH9_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH8_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH7_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH6_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH5_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH4_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH3_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH2_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH1_TYPE
field.description: No description available

field.name: CH0_TYPE
field.description: Type of Channel 0 2'b00: dec-by-3 wiith filter type0 (CIC Compenstation+norm filter) 2'b01: dec-by-3 with filter type 1 (No CIC compenstation, only norm filter)

field.name: POST_SCALE
field.description: the shift value after CIC results.

field.name: SGD
field.description: Sigma_delta_order[1:0] 2'b00: 7 2'b01: 6 2'b10: 5 Others: unused

field.name: CIC_DEC_RATIO
field.description: CIC decimation factor

field.name: MAX_PTR
field.description: The buf size-1 for each channel

field.name: PITCH
field.description: The spacing between starting address of adjacent channels

field.name: START_ADDR
field.description: The starting address of channel 0 in filter data buffer

field.name: COEF_LEN_M0
field.description: Coef length of filter type 2'b00 in coef memory

field.name: COEF_START_ADDR
field.description: Starting address of Coef of filter type 2'b00 in coef memory

field.name: COEF_LEN_M1
field.description: Coef length of filter type 2'b01 in coef memory

field.name: COEF_START_ADDR
field.description: Starting address of Coef of filter type 2'b01 in coef memory

field.name: PDM_EN
field.description: Asserted to enable the module

field.name: ADDR
field.description: 0--0x0FFFFFFF: COEF_RAM 0x10000000--0x1FFFFFFF: DATA_RAM

field.name: DATA
field.description: The data write-to/read-from buffer

field.name: COEF
field.description: Composite value of coef A of the Order-1 HPF

field.name: COEF
field.description: coef B of the Order-1 HPF

field.name: EVT
field.description: Endianness Test Value The endianness test value is 0x87654321.

register.name: DBTP
register.description: data bit timing and prescaler, writeable when CCCR.CCE and CCCR.INT are set

field.name: TDC
field.description: transmitter delay compensation enable 0= Transmitter Delay Compensation disabled 1= Transmitter Delay Compensation enabled

field.name: DBRP
field.description: Data Bit Rate Prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Bit Rate Prescaler are 0 to 31. When TDC = 1, the range is limited to 0,1. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: DTSEG1
field.description: Data time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 31. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

field.name: DTSEG2
field.description: Data time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 15. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

field.name: DSJW
field.description: Data (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Valid values are 0 to 15. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: SVAL
field.description: Started Valid 0= Value of TXBNS not valid 1= Value of TXBNS valid

field.name: TXBNS
field.description: Tx Buffer Number Started Tx Buffer number of message whose transmission was started last. Valid when SVAL is set. Valid values are 0 to 31.

field.name: PVAL
field.description: Prepared Valid 0= Value of TXBNP not valid 1= Value of TXBNP valid

field.name: TXBNP
field.description: Tx Buffer Number Prepared Tx Buffer number of message that is ready for transmission. Valid when PVAL is set.Valid values are 0 to 31.

field.name: RX
field.description: Receive Pin Monitors the actual value of pin m_can_rx 0= The CAN bus is dominant (m_can_rx = 0) 1= The CAN bus is recessive (m_can_rx = 1)

field.name: TX
field.description: Control of Transmit Pin 00 Reset value, m_can_tx controlled by the CAN Core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time 01 Sample Point can be monitored at pin m_can_tx 10 Dominant (0) level at pin m_can_tx 11 Recessive (1) at pin m_can_tx

field.name: LBCK
field.description: Loop Back Mode 0= Reset value, Loop Back Mode is disabled 1= Loop Back Mode is enabled

field.name: WDV
field.description: Watchdog Value Actual Message RAM Watchdog Counter Value.

field.name: WDC
field.description: Watchdog Configuration Start value of the Message RAM Watchdog Counter. With the reset value of 00 the counter is disabled.

field.name: NISO
field.description: Non ISO Operation If this bit is set, the M_CAN uses the CAN FD frame format as specified by the Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0. 0= CAN FD frame format according to ISO 11898-1:2015 1= CAN FD frame format according to Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0 Note: When the generic parameter iso_only_g is set to 1 in hardware synthesis, this bit becomes reserved and is read as 0. The M_CAN always operates with the CAN FD frame format according to ISO 11898-1:2015.

field.name: TXP
field.description: Transmit Pause If this bit is set, the M_CAN pauses for two CAN bit times before starting the next transmission after itself has successfully transmitted a frame (see Section 3.5). 0= Transmit pause disabled 1= Transmit pause enabled

field.name: EFBI
field.description: Edge Filtering during Bus Integration 0= Edge filtering disabled 1= Two consecutive dominant tq required to detect an edge for hard synchronization

field.name: PXHD
field.description: Protocol Exception Handling Disable 0= Protocol exception handling enabled 1= Protocol exception handling disabled Note: When protocol exception handling is disabled, the M_CAN will transmit an error frame when it detects a protocol exception condition.

field.name: WMM
field.description: Wide Message Marker Enables the use of 16-bit Wide Message Markers. When 16-bit Wide Message Markers are used (WMM = 1), 16-bit internal timestamping is disabled for the Tx Event FIFO. 0= 8-bit Message Marker used 1= 16-bit Message Marker used, replacing 16-bit timestamps in Tx Event FIFO

field.name: UTSU
field.description: Use Timestamping Unit When UTSU is set, 16-bit Wide Message Markers are also enabled regardless of the value of WMM. 0= Internal time stamping 1= External time stamping by TSU Note: When generic parameter connected_tsu_g = 0, there is no TSU connected to the M_CAN. In this case bit UTSU is fixed to zero by synthesis.

field.name: BRSE
field.description: Bit Rate Switch Enable 0= Bit rate switching for transmissions disabled 1= Bit rate switching for transmissions enabled Note: When CAN FD operation is disabled FDOE = 0, BRSE is not evaluated.

field.name: FDOE
field.description: FD Operation Enable 0= FD operation disabled 1= FD operation enabled

field.name: TEST
field.description: Test Mode Enable 0= Normal operation, register TEST holds reset values 1= Test Mode, write access to register TEST enabled

field.name: DAR
field.description: Disable Automatic Retransmission 0= Automatic retransmission of messages not transmitted successfully enabled 1= Automatic retransmission disabled

field.name: MON
field.description: Bus Monitoring Mode Bit MON can only be set by the Host when both CCE and INIT are set to 1. The bit can be reset by the Host at any time. 0= Bus Monitoring Mode is disabled 1= Bus Monitoring Mode is enabled

field.name: CSR
field.description: Clock Stop Request 0= No clock stop is requested 1= Clock stop requested. When clock stop is requested, first INIT and then CSA will be set after all pending transfer requests have been completed and the CAN bus reached idle.

field.name: CSA
field.description: Clock Stop Acknowledge 0= No clock stop acknowledged 1= M_CAN may be set in power down by stopping m_can_hclk and m_can_cclk

field.name: ASM
field.description: Restricted Operation Mode Bit ASM can only be set by the Host when both CCE and INIT are set to 1. The bit can be reset by the Host at any time. For a description of the Restricted Operation Mode see Section 3.1.5. 0= Normal CAN operation 1= Restricted Operation Mode active

field.name: CCE
field.description: Configuration Change Enable 0= The CPU has no write access to the protected configuration registers 1= The CPU has write access to the protected configuration registers (while CCCR.INIT = 1)

field.name: INIT
field.description: Initialization 0= Normal Operation 1= Initialization is started

register.name: NBTP
register.description: nominal bit timing and prescaler register

field.name: NSJW
field.description: Nominal (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Valid values are 0 to 127. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: NBRP
field.description: Nominal Bit Rate Prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Bit Rate Prescaler are 0 to 511. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: NTSEG1
field.description: Nominal Time segment before sample point Valid values are 1 to 255. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

field.name: NTSEG2
field.description: Nominal Time segment after sample point Valid values are 1 to 127. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

field.name: TCP
field.description: Timestamp Counter Prescaler Configures the timestamp and timeout counters time unit in multiples of CAN bit times [116]. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

field.name: TSS
field.description: timestamp Select 00= Timestamp counter value always 0x0000 01= Timestamp counter value incremented according to TCP 10= External timestamp counter value used 11= Same as 00

field.name: TSC
field.description: Timestamp Counter The internal/external Timestamp Counter value is captured on start of frame (both Rx and Tx).When TSCC.TSS = 01, the Timestamp Counter is incremented in multiples of CAN bit times [116] depending on the configuration of TSCC.TCP. A wrap around sets interrupt flag IR.TSW. Write access resets the counter to zero. When TSCC.TSS = 10, TSC reflects the external Timestamp Counter value. A write access has no impact.

field.name: TOP
field.description: Timeout Period Start value of the Timeout Counter (down-counter). Configures the Timeout Period.

field.name: TOS
field.description: Timeout Select When operating in Continuous mode, a write to TOCV presets the counter to the value configured by TOCC.TOP and continues down-counting. When the Timeout Counter is controlled by one of the FIFOs, an empty FIFO presets the counter to the value configured by TOCC.TOP. Down-counting is started when the first FIFO element is stored. 00= Continuous operation 01= Timeout controlled by Tx Event FIFO 10= Timeout controlled by Rx FIFO 0 11= Timeout controlled by Rx FIFO 1

field.name: RP
field.description: Enable Timeout Counter 0= Timeout Counter disabled 1= Timeout Counter enabled

field.name: TOC
field.description: Timeout Counter The Timeout Counter is decremented in multiples of CAN bit times [116] depending on the configuration of TSCC.TCP. When decremented to zero, interrupt flag IR.TOO is set and the Timeout Counter is stopped. Start and reset/restart conditions are configured via TOCC.TOS. Note: Byte access: when TOCC.TOS = 00writing one of the register bytes 3/2/1/0 will preset the Timeout Counter.

field.name: CEL
field.description: CAN Error Logging The counter is incremented each time when a CAN protocol error causes the 8-bit Transmit Error Counter TEC or the 7-bit Receive Error Counter REC to be incremented. The counter is also incremented when the Bus_Off limit is reached. It is not incremented when only RP is set without changing REC. The increment of CEL follows after the increment of REC or TEC. The counter is reset by read access to CEL. The counter stops at 0xFF; the next increment of TEC or REC sets interrupt flag IR.ELO. Note: Byte access: Reading byte 2 will reset CEL to zero, reading bytes 3/1/0 has no impact.

field.name: RP
field.description: Receive Error Passive 0= The Receive Error Counter is below the error passive level of 128 1= The Receive Error Counter has reached the error passive level of 128

field.name: REC
field.description: Receive Error Counter Actual state of the Receive Error Counter, values between 0 and 127

field.name: TEC
field.description: Transmit Error Counter Actual state of the Transmit Error Counter, values between 0 and 255 Note: When CCCR.ASM is set, the CAN protocol controller does not increment TEC and REC when a CAN protocol error is detected, but CEL is still incremented.

field.name: TDCV
field.description: Transmitter Delay Compensation Value Position of the secondary sample point, defined by the sum of the measured delay from m_can_tx to m_can_rx and TDCR.TDCO. The SSP position is, in the data phase, the number of mtq between the start of the transmitted bit and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq.

field.name: PXE
field.description: Protocol Exception Event 0= No protocol exception event occurred since last read access 1= Protocol exception event occurred Note: Byte access: Reading byte 0 will reset PXE, reading bytes 3/2/1 has no impact.

field.name: RFDF
field.description: Received a CAN FD Message This bit is set independent of acceptance filtering. 0= Since this bit was reset by the CPU, no CAN FD message has been received 1= Message in CAN FD format with FDF flag set has been received Note: Byte access: Reading byte 0 will reset RFDF, reading bytes 3/2/1 has no impact.

field.name: RBRS
field.description: BRS flag of last received CAN FD Message This bit is set together with RFDF, independent of acceptance filtering. 0= Last received CAN FD message did not have its BRS flag set 1= Last received CAN FD message had its BRS flag set Note: Byte access: Reading byte 0 will reset RBRS, reading bytes 3/2/1 has no impact.

field.name: RESI
field.description: ESI flag of last received CAN FD Message This bit is set together with RFDF, independent of acceptance filtering. 0= Last received CAN FD message did not have its ESI flag set 1= Last received CAN FD message had its ESI flag set Note: Byte access: Reading byte 0 will reset RESI, reading bytes 3/2/1 has no impact.

field.name: DLEC
field.description: Data Phase Last Error Code Type of last error that occurred in the data phase of a CAN FD format frame with its BRS flag set.Coding is the same as for LEC. This field will be cleared to zero when a CAN FD format frame with its BRS flag set has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. Note: Byte access: Reading byte 0 will set DLEC to 111, reading bytes 3/2/1 has no impact.

field.name: BO
field.description: Bus_Off Status 0= The M_CAN is not Bus_Off 1= The M_CAN is in Bus_Off state

field.name: EW
field.description: Warning Status 0= Both error counters are below the Error_Warning limit of 96 1= At least one of error counter has reached the Error_Warning limit of 96

field.name: EP
field.description: Error Passive 0= The M_CAN is in the Error_Active state. It normally takes part in bus communication and sends an active error flag when an error has been detected 1= The M_CAN is in the Error_Passive state

field.name: ACT
field.description: Activity Monitors the modules CAN communication state. 00= Synchronizing - node is synchronizing on CAN communication 01= Idle - node is neither receiver nor transmitter 10= Receiver - node is operating as receiver 11= Transmitter - node is operating as transmitter Note: ACT is set to 00 by a Protocol Exception Event.

field.name: LEC
field.description: Last Error Code The LEC indicates the type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus. This field will be cleared to 0when a message has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. 0= No Error: No error occurred since LEC has been reset by successful reception or transmission. 1= Stuff Error: More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed. 2= Form Error: A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format. 3= AckError: The message transmitted by the M_CAN was not acknowledged by another node. 4= Bit1Error: During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a recessive level (bit of logical value 1), but the monitored bus value was dominant. 5= Bit0Error: During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value0), but the monitored bus value was recessive. During Bus_Off recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the CPU to monitor the proceeding of the Bus_Off recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at dominant or continuously disturbed). 6= CRCError: The CRC check sum of a received message was incorrect. The CRC of an incoming message does not match with the CRC calculated from the received data. 7= NoChange: Any read access to the Protocol Status Register re-initializes the LEC to 7. When the LEC shows the value 7, no CAN bus event was detected since the last CPU read access to the Protocol Status Register. Note: When a frame in CAN FD format has reached the data phase with BRS flag set, the next CAN event (error or valid frame) will be shown in DLEC instead of LEC. An error in a fixed stuff bit of a CAN FD CRC sequence will be shown as a Form Error, not Stuff Error. Note: The Bus_Off recovery sequence (see ISO 11898-1:2015) cannot be shortened by setting or resetting CCCR.INIT. If the device goes Bus_Off, it will set CCCR.INIT of its own accord,stopping all bus activities. Once CCCR.INIT has been cleared by the CPU, the device will then wait for 129 occurrences of Bus Idle (129 * 11 consecutive recessive bits) before resuming normal operation. At the end of the Bus_Off recovery sequence, the Error Management Counters will be reset. During the waiting time after the resetting of CCCR.INIT, each time a sequence of 11 recessive bits has been monitored, a Bit0Error code is written to PSR.LEC, enabling the CPU to readily check up whether the CAN bus is stuck at dominant or continuously disturbed and to monitor the Bus_Off recovery sequence. ECR.REC is used to count these sequences. Note: Byte access: Reading byte 0 will set LEC to 111, reading bytes 3/2/1 has no impact.

field.name: TDCO
field.description: Transmitter Delay Compensation SSP Offset Offset value defining the distance between the measured delay from m_can_tx to m_can_rx and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq.

field.name: TDCF
field.description: Transmitter Delay Compensation Filter Window Length Defines the minimum value for the SSP position, dominant edges on m_can_rx that would result in an earlier SSP position are ignored for transmitter delay measurement. The feature is enabled when TDCF is configured to a value greater than TDCO. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq.

field.name: ARA
field.description: Access to Reserved Address 0= No access to reserved address occurred 1= Access to reserved address occurred

field.name: PED
field.description: Protocol Error in Data Phase (Data Bit Time is used) 0= No protocol error in data phase 1= Protocol error in data phase detected (PSR.DLEC 0,7)

field.name: PEA
field.description: Protocol Error in Arbitration Phase (Nominal Bit Time is used) 0= No protocol error in arbitration phase 1= Protocol error in arbitration phase detected (PSR.LEC 0,7)

field.name: WDI
field.description: Watchdog Interrupt 0= No Message RAM Watchdog event occurred 1= Message RAM Watchdog event due to missing READY

field.name: BO
field.description: Bus_Off Status 0= Bus_Off status unchanged 1= Bus_Off status changed

field.name: EW
field.description: Warning Status 0= Error_Warning status unchanged 1= Error_Warning status changed

field.name: EP
field.description: Error Passive 0= Error_Passive status unchanged 1= Error_Passive status changed

field.name: ELO
field.description: Error Logging Overflow 0= CAN Error Logging Counter did not overflow 1= Overflow of CAN Error Logging Counter occurred

field.name: BEU
field.description: Bit Error Uncorrected Message RAM bit error detected, uncorrected. Controlled by input signal m_can_aeim_berr[1] generated by an optional external parity / ECC logic attached to the Message RAM. An uncorrected Message RAM bit error sets CCCR.INIT to 1. This is done to avoid transmission of corrupted data. 0= No bit error detected when reading from Message RAM 1= Bit error detected, uncorrected (e.g. parity logic)

field.name: BEC
field.description: Bit Error Corrected Message RAM bit error detected and corrected. Controlled by input signal m_can_aeim_berr[0] generated by an optional external parity / ECC logic attached to the Message RAM. 0= No bit error detected when reading from Message RAM 1= Bit error detected and corrected (e.g. ECC)

field.name: DRX
field.description: Message stored to Dedicated Rx Buffer The flag is set whenever a received message has been stored into a dedicated Rx Buffer. 0= No Rx Buffer updated 1= At least one received message stored into an Rx Buffer

field.name: TOO
field.description: Timeout Occurred 0= No timeout 1= Timeout reached

field.name: MRAF
field.description: Message RAM Access Failure The flag is set, when the Rx Handler .has not completed acceptance filtering or storage of an accepted message until the arbitration field of the following message has been received. In this case acceptance filtering or message storage is aborted and the Rx Handler starts processing of the following message. .was not able to write a message to the Message RAM. In this case message storage is aborted. In both cases the FIFO put index is not updated resp. the New Data flag for a dedicated Rx Buffer is not set, a partly stored message is overwritten when the next message is stored to this location. The flag is also set when the Tx Handler was not able to read a message from the Message RAM in time. In this case message transmission is aborted. In case of a Tx Handler access failure the M_CAN is switched into Restricted Operation Mode (see Section 3.1.5). To leave Restricted Operation Mode, the Host CPU has to reset CCCR.ASM. 0= No Message RAM access failure occurred 1= Message RAM access failure occurred

field.name: TSW
field.description: Timestamp Wraparound 0= No timestamp counter wrap-around 1= Timestamp counter wrapped around

field.name: TEFL
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Element Lost 0= No Tx Event FIFO element lost 1= Tx Event FIFO element lost, also set after write attempt to Tx Event FIFO of size zero

field.name: TEFF
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Full 0= Tx Event FIFO not full 1= Tx Event FIFO full

field.name: TEFW
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Watermark Reached 0= Tx Event FIFO fill level below watermark 1= Tx Event FIFO fill level reached watermark

field.name: TEFN
field.description: Tx Event FIFO New Entry 0= Tx Event FIFO unchanged 1= Tx Handler wrote Tx Event FIFO element

field.name: TFE
field.description: Tx FIFO Empty 0= Tx FIFO non-empty 1= Tx FIFO empty

field.name: TCF
field.description: Transmission Cancellation Finished 0= No transmission cancellation finished 1= Transmission cancellation finished

field.name: TC
field.description: Transmission Completed 0= No transmission completed 1= Transmission completed

field.name: HPM
field.description: High Priority Message 0= No high priority message received 1= High priority message received

field.name: RF1L
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost 0= No Rx FIFO 1 message lost 1= Rx FIFO 1 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 1 of size zero

field.name: RF1F
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Full 0= Rx FIFO 1 not full 1= Rx FIFO 1 full

field.name: RF1W
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Watermark Reached 0= Rx FIFO 1 fill level below watermark 1= Rx FIFO 1 fill level reached watermark

field.name: RF1N
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 New Message 0= No new message written to Rx FIFO 1 1= New message written to Rx FIFO 1

field.name: RF0L
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost 0= No Rx FIFO 0 message lost 1= Rx FIFO 0 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 0 of size zero

field.name: RF0F
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Full 0= Rx FIFO 0 not full 1= Rx FIFO 0 full

field.name: RF0W
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Watermark Reached 0= Rx FIFO 0 fill level below watermark 1= Rx FIFO 0 fill level reached watermark

field.name: RF0N
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 New Message 0= No new message written to Rx FIFO 0 1= New message written to Rx FIFO 0

field.name: ARAE
field.description: Access to Reserved Address Enable

field.name: PEDE
field.description: Protocol Error in Data Phase Enable

field.name: PEAE
field.description: Protocol Error in Arbitration Phase Enable

field.name: WDIE
field.description: Watchdog Interrupt Enable

field.name: BOE
field.description: Bus_Off Status Interrupt Enable

field.name: EWE
field.description: Warning Status Interrupt Enable

field.name: EPE
field.description: Error Passive Interrupt Enable

field.name: ELOE
field.description: Error Logging Overflow Interrupt Enable

field.name: BEUE
field.description: Bit Error Uncorrected Interrupt Enable

field.name: BECE
field.description: Bit Error Corrected Interrupt Enable

field.name: DRXE
field.description: Message stored to Dedicated Rx Buffer Interrupt Enable

field.name: TOOE
field.description: Timeout Occurred Interrupt Enable

field.name: MRAFE
field.description: Message RAM Access Failure Interrupt Enable

field.name: TSWE
field.description: Timestamp Wraparound Interrupt Enable

field.name: TEFLE
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Event Lost Interrupt Enable

field.name: TEFFE
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Full Interrupt Enable

field.name: TEFWE
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Watermark Reached Interrupt Enable

field.name: TEFNE
field.description: Tx Event FIFO New Entry Interrupt Enable

field.name: TFEE
field.description: Tx FIFO Empty Interrupt Enable

field.name: TCFE
field.description: Transmission Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable

field.name: TCE
field.description: Transmission Completed Interrupt Enable

field.name: HPME
field.description: High Priority Message Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF1LE
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF1FE
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Full Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF1WE
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Watermark Reached Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF1NE
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 New Message Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF0LE
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF0FE
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Full Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF0WE
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Watermark Reached Interrupt Enable

field.name: RF0NE
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 New Message Interrupt Enable

field.name: ARAL
field.description: Access to Reserved Address Line

field.name: PEDL
field.description: Protocol Error in Data Phase Line

field.name: PEAL
field.description: Protocol Error in Arbitration Phase Line

field.name: WDIL
field.description: Watchdog Interrupt Line

field.name: BOL
field.description: Bus_Off Status Interrupt Line

field.name: EWL
field.description: Warning Status Interrupt Line

field.name: EPL
field.description: Error Passive Interrupt Line

field.name: ELOL
field.description: Error Logging Overflow Interrupt Line

field.name: BEUL
field.description: Bit Error Uncorrected Interrupt Line

field.name: BECL
field.description: Bit Error Corrected Interrupt Line

field.name: DRXL
field.description: Message stored to Dedicated Rx Buffer Interrupt Line

field.name: TOOL
field.description: Timeout Occurred Interrupt Line

field.name: MRAFL
field.description: Message RAM Access Failure Interrupt Line

field.name: TSWL
field.description: Timestamp Wraparound Interrupt Line

field.name: TEFLL
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Event Lost Interrupt Line

field.name: TEFFL
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Full Interrupt Line

field.name: TEFWL
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Watermark Reached Interrupt Line

field.name: TEFNL
field.description: Tx Event FIFO New Entry Interrupt Line

field.name: TFEL
field.description: Tx FIFO Empty Interrupt Line

field.name: TCFL
field.description: Transmission Cancellation Finished Interrupt Line

field.name: TCL
field.description: Transmission Completed Interrupt Line

field.name: HPML
field.description: High Priority Message Interrupt Line

field.name: RF1LL
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost Interrupt Line

field.name: RF1FL
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Full Interrupt Line

field.name: RF1WL
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Watermark Reached Interrupt Line

field.name: RF1NL
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 New Message Interrupt Line

field.name: RF0LL
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost Interrupt Line

field.name: RF0FL
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Full Interrupt Line

field.name: RF0WL
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Watermark Reached Interrupt Line

field.name: RF0NL
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 New Message Interrupt Line

field.name: EINT1
field.description: Enable Interrupt Line 1 0= Interrupt line m_can_int1 disabled 1= Interrupt line m_can_int1 enabled

field.name: EINT0
field.description: Enable Interrupt Line 0 0= Interrupt line m_can_int0 disabled 1= Interrupt line m_can_int0 enabled

field.name: ANFS
field.description: Accept Non-matching Frames Standard Defines how received messages with 11-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. 00= Accept in Rx FIFO 0 01= Accept in Rx FIFO 1 10= Reject 11= Reject

field.name: ANFE
field.description: Accept Non-matching Frames Extended Defines how received messages with 29-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. 00= Accept in Rx FIFO 0 01= Accept in Rx FIFO 1 10= Reject 11= Reject

field.name: RRFS
field.description: Reject Remote Frames Standard 0= Filter remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs 1= Reject all remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs

field.name: RRFE
field.description: Reject Remote Frames Extended 0= Filter remote frames with 29-bit extended IDs 1= Reject all remote frames with 29-bit extended IDs

field.name: LSS
field.description: List Size Standard 0= No standard Message ID filter 1-128= Number of standard Message ID filter elements >128= Values greater than 128 are interpreted as 128

field.name: FLSSA
field.description: Filter List Standard Start Address Start address of standard Message ID filter list (32-bit word address)

field.name: LSE
field.description: List Size Extended 0= No extended Message ID filter 1-64= Number of extended Message ID filter elements >64= Values greater than 64 are interpreted as 64

field.name: FLESA
field.description: Filter List Extended Start Address Start address of extended Message ID filter list (32-bit word address).

field.name: EIDM
field.description: Extended ID Mask For acceptance filtering of extended frames the Extended ID AND Mask is ANDed with the Message ID of a received frame. Intended for masking of 29-bit IDs in SAE J1939. With the reset value of all bits set to one the mask is not active.

field.name: FLST
field.description: Filter List Indicates the filter list of the matching filter element. 0= Standard Filter List 1= Extended Filter List

field.name: FIDX
field.description: Filter Index Index of matching filter element. Range is 0 to SIDFC.LSS - 1 resp. XIDFC.LSE - 1.

field.name: MSI
field.description: Message Storage Indicator 00= No FIFO selected 01= FIFO message lost 10= Message stored in FIFO 0 11= Message stored in FIFO 1

field.name: BIDX
field.description: Buffer Index Index of Rx FIFO element to which the message was stored. Only valid when MSI[1] = 1.

field.name: ND1
field.description: New Data[31:0] The register holds the New Data flags of Rx Buffers 0 to 31. The flags are set when the respective Rx Buffer has been updated from a received frame. The flags remain set until the Host clears them.A flag is cleared by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit position. Writing a 0 has no effect. A hard reset will clear the register. 0= Rx Buffer not updated 1= Rx Buffer updated from new message

field.name: ND2
field.description: New Data[63:32] The register holds the New Data flags of Rx Buffers 32 to 63. The flags are set when the respective Rx Buffer has been updated from a received frame. The flags remain set until the Host clears them. A flag is cleared by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit position. Writing a 0 has no effect. A hard reset will clear the register. 0= Rx Buffer not updated 1= Rx Buffer updated from new message

field.name: F0OM
field.description: FIFO 0 Operation Mode FIFO 0 can be operated in blocking or in overwrite mode (see Section 3.4.2). 0= FIFO 0 blocking mode 1= FIFO 0 overwrite mode

field.name: F0WM
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Watermark 0= Watermark interrupt disabled 1-64= Level for Rx FIFO 0 watermark interrupt (IR.RF0W) >64= Watermark interrupt disabled

field.name: F0S
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Size 0= No Rx FIFO 0 1-64= Number of Rx FIFO 0 elements >64= Values greater than 64 are interpreted as 64 The Rx FIFO 0 elements are indexed from 0 to F0S-1

field.name: F0SA
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Start Address Start address of Rx FIFO 0 in Message RAM (32-bit word address)

field.name: RF0L
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR.RF0L. When IR.RF0L is reset, this bit is also reset. 0= No Rx FIFO 0 message lost 1= Rx FIFO 0 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 0 of size zero Note: Overwriting the oldest message when RXF0C.F0OM = 1 will not set this flag.

field.name: F0F
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Full 0= Rx FIFO 0 not full 1= Rx FIFO 0 full

field.name: F0PI
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Put Index Rx FIFO 0 write index pointer, range 0 to 63.

field.name: F0GI
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Get Index Rx FIFO 0 read index pointer, range 0 to 63.

field.name: F0FL
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Fill Level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 0, range 0 to 64.

field.name: F0AI
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Acknowledge Index After the Host has read a message or a sequence of messages from Rx FIFO 0 it has to write the buffer index of the last element read from Rx FIFO 0 to F0AI. This will set the Rx FIFO 0 Get Index RXF0S.F0GI to F0AI + 1 and update the FIFO 0 Fill Level RXF0S.F0FL.

field.name: RBSA
field.description: Rx Buffer Start Address Configures the start address of the Rx Buffers section in the Message RAM (32-bit word address).Also used to reference debug messages A,B,C.

field.name: F1OM
field.description: FIFO 1 Operation Mode FIFO 1 can be operated in blocking or in overwrite mode (see Section 3.4.2). 0= FIFO 1 blocking mode 1= FIFO 1 overwrite mode

field.name: F1WM
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Watermark 0= Watermark interrupt disabled 1-64= Level for Rx FIFO 1 watermark interrupt (IR.RF1W) >64= Watermark interrupt disabled

field.name: F1S
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Size 0= No Rx FIFO 1 1-64= Number of Rx FIFO 1 elements >64= Values greater than 64 are interpreted as 64 The Rx FIFO 1 elements are indexed from 0 to F1S - 1

field.name: F1SA
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Start Address Start address of Rx FIFO 1 in Message RAM (32-bit word address)

field.name: DMS
field.description: Debug Message Status 00= Idle state, wait for reception of debug messages, DMA request is cleared 01= Debug message A received 10= Debug messages A, B received 11= Debug messages A, B, C received, DMA request is set

field.name: RF1L
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR.RF1L. When IR.RF1L is reset, this bit is also reset. 0= No Rx FIFO 1 message lost 1= Rx FIFO 1 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 1 of size zero Note: Overwriting the oldest message when RXF1C.F1OM = 1 will not set this flag.

field.name: F1F
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Full 0= Rx FIFO 1 not full 1= Rx FIFO 1 full

field.name: F1PI
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Put Index Rx FIFO 1 write index pointer, range 0 to 63.

field.name: F1GI
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Get Index Rx FIFO 1 read index pointer, range 0 to 63.

field.name: F1FL
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Fill Level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 1, range 0 to 64.

field.name: F1AI
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Acknowledge Index After the Host has read a message or a sequence of messages from Rx FIFO 1 it has to write the buffer index of the last element read from Rx FIFO 1 to F1AI. This will set the Rx FIFO 1 Get Index RXF1S.F1GI to F1AI + 1 and update the FIFO 1 Fill Level RXF1S.F1FL.

field.name: RBDS
field.description: Rx Buffer Data Field Size 000= 8 byte data field 001= 12 byte data field 010= 16 byte data field 011= 20 byte data field 100= 24 byte data field 101= 32 byte data field 110= 48 byte data field 111= 64 byte data field

field.name: F1DS
field.description: Rx FIFO 1 Data Field Size 000= 8 byte data field 001= 12 byte data field 010= 16 byte data field 011= 20 byte data field 100= 24 byte data field 101= 32 byte data field 110= 48 byte data field 111= 64 byte data field

field.name: F0DS
field.description: Rx FIFO 0 Data Field Size 000= 8 byte data field 001= 12 byte data field 010= 16 byte data field 011= 20 byte data field 100= 24 byte data field 101= 32 byte data field 110= 48 byte data field 111= 64 byte data field Note: In case the data field size of an accepted CAN frame exceeds the data field size configured for the matching Rx Buffer or Rx FIFO, only the number of bytes as configured by RXESC are stored to the Rx Buffer resp. Rx FIFO element. The rest of the frames data field is ignored.

field.name: TFQM
field.description: Tx FIFO/Queue Mode 0= Tx FIFO operation 1= Tx Queue operation

field.name: TFQS
field.description: Transmit FIFO/Queue Size 0= No Tx FIFO/Queue 1-32= Number of Tx Buffers used for Tx FIFO/Queue >32= Values greater than 32 are interpreted as 32

field.name: NDTB
field.description: Number of Dedicated Transmit Buffers 0= No Dedicated Tx Buffers 1-32= Number of Dedicated Tx Buffers >32= Values greater than 32 are interpreted as 32

field.name: TBSA
field.description: Tx Buffers Start Address Start address of Tx Buffers section in Message RAM (32-bit word address, see Figure 2). Note: Be aware that the sum of TFQS and NDTB may be not greater than 32. There is no check for erroneous configurations. The Tx Buffers section in the Message RAM starts with the dedicated Tx Buffers.

field.name: TFQF
field.description: Tx FIFO/Queue Full 0= Tx FIFO/Queue not full 1= Tx FIFO/Queue full

field.name: TFQPI
field.description: Tx FIFO/Queue Put Index Tx FIFO/Queue write index pointer, range 0 to 31.

field.name: TFGI
field.description: Tx FIFO Get Index Tx FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 31. Read as zero when Tx Queue operation is configured (TXBC.TFQM = 1).

field.name: TFFL
field.description: Tx FIFO Free Level Number of consecutive free Tx FIFO elements starting from TFGI, range 0 to 32. Read as zero when Tx Queue operation is configured (TXBC.TFQM = 1) Note: In case of mixed configurations where dedicated Tx Buffers are combined with a Tx FIFO or a Tx Queue, the Put and Get Indices indicate the number of the Tx Buffer starting with the first dedicated Tx Buffers. Example: For a configuration of 12 dedicated Tx Buffers and a Tx FIFO of 20 Buffers a Put Index of 15 points to the fourth buffer of the Tx FIFO.

field.name: TBDS
field.description: Tx Buffer Data Field Size 000= 8 byte data field 001= 12 byte data field 010= 16 byte data field 011= 20 byte data field 100= 24 byte data field 101= 32 byte data field 110= 48 byte data field 111= 64 byte data field Note: In case the data length code DLC of a Tx Buffer element is configured to a value higher than the Tx Buffer data field size TXESC.TBDS, the bytes not defined by the Tx Buffer are transmitted as 0xCC (padding bytes).

field.name: TRP
field.description: Transmission Request Pending Each Tx Buffer has its own Transmission Request Pending bit. The bits are set via register TXBAR.The bits are reset after a requested transmission has completed or has been cancelled via register TXBCR. TXBRP bits are set only for those Tx Buffers configured via TXBC. After a TXBRP bit has been set, a Tx scan (see Section 3.5, Tx Handling) is started to check for the pending Tx request with the highest priority (Tx Buffer with lowest Message ID). A cancellation request resets the corresponding transmission request pending bit of register TXBRP. In case a transmission has already been started when a cancellation is requested, this is done at the end of the transmission, regardless whether the transmission was successful or not. The cancellation request bits are reset directly after the corresponding TXBRP bit has been reset. After a cancellation has been requested, a finished cancellation is signalled via TXBCF ? after successful transmission together with the corresponding TXBTO bit ? when the transmission has not yet been started at the point of cancellation ? when the transmission has been aborted due to lost arbitration ? when an error occurred during frame transmission In DAR mode all transmissions are automatically cancelled if they are not successful. The corresponding TXBCF bit is set for all unsuccessful transmissions. 0= No transmission request pending 1= Transmission request pending Note: TXBRP bits which are set while a Tx scan is in progress are not considered during this particular Tx scan. In case a cancellation is requested for such a Tx Buffer, this Add Request is cancelled immediately, the corresponding TXBRP bit is reset.

field.name: AR
field.description: Add Request Each Tx Buffer has its own Add Request bit. Writing a 1 will set the corresponding Add Request bit; writing a 0 has no impact. This enables the Host to set transmission requests for multiple Tx Buffers with one write to TXBAR. TXBAR bits are set only for those Tx Buffers configured via TXBC. When no Tx scan is running, the bits are reset immediately, else the bits remain set until the Tx scan process has completed. 0= No transmission request added 1= Transmission requested added Note: If an add request is applied for a Tx Buffer with pending transmission request (corresponding TXBRP bit already set), this add request is ignored.

field.name: CR
field.description: Cancellation Request Each Tx Buffer has its own Cancellation Request bit. Writing a 1 will set the corresponding Cancellation Request bit; writing a 0 has no impact. This enables the Host to set cancellation requests for multiple Tx Buffers with one write to TXBCR. TXBCR bits are set only for those Tx Buffers configured via TXBC. The bits remain set until the corresponding bit of TXBRP is reset. 0= No cancellation pending 1= Cancellation pending

field.name: TO
field.description: Transmission Occurred Each Tx Buffer has its own Transmission Occurred bit. The bits are set when the corresponding TXBRP bit is cleared after a successful transmission. The bits are reset when a new transmission is requested by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit of register TXBAR. 0= No transmission occurred 1= Transmission occurred

field.name: CF
field.description: Cancellation Finished Each Tx Buffer has its own Cancellation Finished bit. The bits are set when the corresponding TXBRP bit is cleared after a cancellation was requested via TXBCR. In case the corresponding TXBRP bit was not set at the point of cancellation, CF is set immediately. The bits are reset when a new transmission is requested by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit of register TXBAR. 0= No transmit buffer cancellation 1= Transmit buffer cancellation finished

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmission Interrupt Enable Each Tx Buffer has its own Transmission Interrupt Enable bit. 0= Transmission interrupt disabled 1= Transmission interrupt enable

register.name: TXBCIE
register.description: tx buffer cancellation finished interrupt enable

field.name: CFIE
field.description: Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable Each Tx Buffer has its own Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable bit. 0= Cancellation finished interrupt disabled 1= Cancellation finished interrupt enabled

field.name: EFWM
field.description: Event FIFO Watermark 0= Watermark interrupt disabled 1-32= Level for Tx Event FIFO watermark interrupt (IR.TEFW) >32= Watermark interrupt disabled

field.name: EFS
field.description: Event FIFO Size 0= Tx Event FIFO disabled 1-32= Number of Tx Event FIFO elements >32= Values greater than 32 are interpreted as 32 The Tx Event FIFO elements are indexed from 0 to EFS - 1

field.name: EFSA
field.description: Event FIFO Start Address Start address of Tx Event FIFO in Message RAM (32-bit word address)

field.name: TEFL
field.description: Tx Event FIFO Element Lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR.TEFL. When IR.TEFL is reset, this bit is also reset. 0= No Tx Event FIFO element lost 1= Tx Event FIFO element lost, also set after write attempt to Tx Event FIFO of size zero.

field.name: EFF
field.description: Event FIFO Full 0= Tx Event FIFO not full 1= Tx Event FIFO full

field.name: EFPI
field.description: Event FIFO Put Index Tx Event FIFO write index pointer, range 0 to 31.

field.name: EFGI
field.description: Event FIFO Get Index Tx Event FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 31.

field.name: EFFL
field.description: Event FIFO Fill Level Number of elements stored in Tx Event FIFO, range 0 to 32.

field.name: EFAI
field.description: Event FIFO Acknowledge Index After the Host has read an element or a sequence of elements from the Tx Event FIFO it has to write the index of the last element read from Tx Event FIFO to EFAI. This will set the Tx Event FIFO Get Index TXEFS.EFGI to EFAI + 1 and update the Event FIFO Fill Level TXEFS.EFFL.

field.name: TS
REL
field.description: Core Release One digit, BCD-coded

field.name: STEP
field.description: Step of Core Release One digit, BCD-coded.

field.name: SUBSTEP
field.description: Sub-step of Core Release One digit, BCD-coded

field.name: YEAR
field.description: Timestamp Year One digit, BCD-coded. This field is set by generic parameter on synthesis.

field.name: MON
field.description: Timestamp Month Two digits, BCD-coded. This field is set by generic parameter on synthesis.

field.name: DAY
field.description: Timestamp Day Two digits, BCD-coded. This field is set by generic parameter on synthesis.

field.name: TBPRE
field.description: Timebase Prescaler 0x00 to 0xFF The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the timebase counter clock. Valid values for the Timebase Prescaler are 0 to 255. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used. Affects only the TSU internal timebase. When the internal timebase is excluded by synthesis, TBPRE[7:0] is fixed to 0x00, the Timestamp Prescaler is not used.

field.name: EN64
field.description: set to use 64bit timestamp. when enabled, tsu can save up to 8 different timestamps, TS(k) and TS(k+1) are used for one 64bit timestamp, k is 0~7. TSP can be used to select different one

field.name: SCP
field.description: Select Capturing Position 0: Capture Timestamp at EOF 1: Capture Timestamp at SOF

field.name: TBCS
field.description: Timebase Counter Select When the internal timebase is excluded by synthesis, TBCS is fixed to 1. 0: Timestamp value captured from internal timebase counter, ATB.TB[31:0] is the internal timbase counter 1: Timestamp value captured from input tsu_tbin[31:0],ATB.TB[31:0] is tsu_tbin[31:0]

field.name: TSUE
field.description: Timestamp Unit Enable 0: TSU disabled 1: TSU enabled

field.name: TSL
field.description: Timestamp Lost Each Timestamp register (TS0-TS15) is assigned one bit. The bits are set when the timestamp stored in the related Timestamp register was overwritten before it was read. Reading a Timestamp register resets the related bit.

field.name: TSN
field.description: Timestamp New Each Timestamp register (TS0-TS15) is assigned one bit. The bits are set when a timestamp was stored in the related Timestamp register. Reading a Timestamp register resets the related bit.

field.name: TSP
field.description: Timestamp Pointer The Timestamp Pointer is incremented by one each time a timestamp is captured. From its maximum value (3, 7, or 15 depending on number_ts_g), it is incremented to 0. Value also signalled on output m_can_tsp[3:0].

field.name: TB
field.description: timebase for timestamp generation 31-0

field.name: TBH
field.description: timebase for timestamp generation 63-32

field.name: M_CAN_STBY
