field.description: Write 1 to reset FD controller and memory pointers. Register Map content remains untouched

field.name: LU_FIFO_DEPTH
field.description: Number of MAC lookup descriptors the FIFO can store.

field.name: FD_DESC_FIFO_DESC
field.description: Number of FD descriptors the FIFO can store. Two descriptors need to be stored per frame.

field.name: FD_FIFO_DESC
field.description: Number of words (4byte) the Frame Drop FIFO can store.

field.name: PORT
field.description: If selected port is set then the frame is transmitted in Store & Forward mode. This is necessary when the ingress rate of this port is slower than the egress rate of the transmitting port. In S&F, the ingress module is able to drop frames with bad CRC.bit 0 - CPU-Port, bit 1 - Port 1,

field.name: PORT
field.description: Port grouping via port mask. If the selected port is not set then the destination will be filtered out. This register allows the realization of port-based-VLAN (no VLAN tags required, only set it by ports). bit 0 - CPU-Port, bit 1 - Port 1,

field.name: PORT
field.description: Mirror Port. If port mirroring is enabled TX/RX traffic will also be forwarded to this port. bit 0 - CPU-Port, bit 1 - Port 1,

field.name: PORT
field.description: Mirror Selection TX. The destination of the frame is compared with this vector. All matching TX probe ports will be mirrored to MIRROR. It is necessary to configure all ingress ports to mirror the complete TX traffic. bit 0 - CPU-Port, bit 1 - Port 1,

field.name: EN
field.description: Enables counter. If deasserted the counter process stops and the counters hold their value.

field.name: RSRX
field.description: Write '1' to reset all RX counters.

field.name: RSTX
field.description: Write '1' to reset all TX counters

field.name: RSALL
field.description: Write '1' to reset all TX&RX counters.

field.name: RX_CNT_EN_VEC
field.description: Vector of implemented RX counters. E.g. 0x000F means only the first 4 RX counter are available.

field.name: TX_CNT_EN_VEC
field.description: Vector of implemented RX counters. E.g. 0x000F means only the first 4 RX counter are available.

field.name: CNTW
field.description: Vector of implemented RX counters. E.g. 0x000F means only the first 4 RX counter are available.

field.name: TX_FGOOD
field.description: Good transmitted Frames to TX TSN-EP.

field.name: TX_FERROR
field.description: Transmitted Frames with Error to TX TSN-EP.

field.name: TX_DROP_OVFL
field.description: Dropped frames by full queue of TSN-EP.

field.name: RX_FGOOD
field.description: Good received frame by ingress buffer.

field.name: RX_FERROR
field.description: Bad received frame by ingress buffer.

field.name: RX_KNOWN
field.description: Number of frames passed ingress with hit by MAC Table. This includes Broadcast and non-relayed frames.

field.name: RX_UNKNOWN
field.description: Number of frames passed ingress without hit by MAC table.

field.name: RX_UC
field.description: Number of unicast frames

field.name: RX_INTERN
field.description: Number of non-relay frames

field.name: RX_BC
field.description: Number of Broadcast frames

field.name: RX_MULTI
field.description: Number of Multicast frames

field.name: RX_VLAN
field.description: Number of VLAN tagged frames

field.name: RX_DROP_OVFL
field.description: Dropped frames by ingress overflow.

field.name: RX_DROP_LU
field.description: Dropped frames by LookUp decision.

field.name: RX_DROP_ERR
field.description: Dropped frames with error by ingress. Possible in S&F mode or when frame is queued in ingress.

field.name: RX_DROP_VLAN
field.description: Dropped frames by incompatible VLAN.

field.name: RX_FPE_FGOOD
field.description: Number of preemptable frames. Subset of RX_FGOOD

field.name: RXCLK_DLY_SEL
field.description: delay value of rxclk_delay_chain

field.name: TXCLK_DLY_SEL
field.description: delay value of txclk_delay_chain

field.name: MAC_SPEED
field.description: mac speed

field.name: PAD_OE_ETH_REFCLK
field.description: refclock output enable when rmii

field.name: PHY_INTF_SEL
field.description: phy interface select

field.name: RMII_TXCLK_SEL
field.description: txclk select control for RMII

field.name: TYPE
field.description: Controller type

field.name: X
field.description: major version X

field.name: BUILD
field.description: No description available

field.name: Y
field.description: minor version Y

field.name: Z
field.description: maintenance version Z

field.name: NUM
field.description: Number of supported FMMU channels (or entities)

field.name: NUM
field.description: Number of supported SyncManager channels (or entities)

field.name: SIZE
field.description: Process Data RAM size supported in KByte

field.name: PORT3
field.description: Port configuration: 00:Not implemented 01:Not configured (SII EEPROM) 10:EBUS 11:MII/RMII/RGMII

field.name: PORT2
field.description: Port configuration: 00:Not implemented 01:Not configured (SII EEPROM) 10:EBUS 11:MII/RMII/RGMII

field.name: PORT1
field.description: Port configuration: 00:Not implemented 01:Not configured (SII EEPROM) 10:EBUS 11:MII/RMII/RGMII

field.name: PORT0
field.description: Port configuration: 00:Not implemented 01:Not configured (SII EEPROM) 10:EBUS 11:MII/RMII/RGMII

field.name: FFSC
field.description: Fixed FMMU/SyncManager configuration: 0:Variable configuration 1:Fixed configuration (refer to documentation of supporting ESCs)

field.name: RWC
field.description: EtherCAT read/write command support(BRW,APRW,FPRW): 0:Supported 1:Not supported

field.name: LRW
field.description: EtherCAT LRW command support: 0:Supported 1:Not supported

field.name: EDSA
field.description: Enhanced DC SYNC Activation: 0:Not available 1:Available Note:This feature refers to registers 0x981[7:3] and 0x0984

field.name: SHFE
field.description: Seperate Handling of FCS Errors: 0:Not supported 1:Supported, frames with wrong FCS and additional nibble will be counted separately in Forwarded RX Error Counter

field.name: ELDM
field.description: Enhanced Link Detection MII: 0:Not available 1:Available

field.name: DCW
field.description: Distributed Clocks width: 0:32 bit 1:64 bit

field.name: DC
field.description: Distributed Clocks: 0:Not available 1:Available

field.name: FMMU
field.description: FMMU Operation: 0:Bit oriented 1:Byte oriented

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Address used for node addressing (FPRD/FPWR/FPRW/FRMW commands)

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Alias Address used for node addressing (FPRD/FPWR/FPRW/FRMW commands). The use of this alias is activated by Register DL Control Bit 0x0100[24]. NOTE:EEPROM value is only transferred into this register at first EEPROM load after power-on or reset. ESC20 exception:EEPROM value is transferred into this register after each EEPROM reload command.

field.name: EN
field.description: If register write protection is enabled, this register has to be written in the same Ethernet frame (value does not matter) before other writes to this station are allowed. This bit is self-clearing at the beginning of the next frame (SOF), or if Register Write Protection is disabled.

field.name: WP
field.description: Register write protection: 0:Protection disabled 1:Protection enabled Registers 0x0000:0x0F7F are write-protected, except for 0x0020 and 0x0030

field.name: EN
field.description: If ESC write protection is enabled, this register has to be written in the same Ethernet frame (value does not matter) before other writes to this station are allowed. This bit is self-clearing at the beginning of the next frame (SOF), or if ESC Write Protection is disabled.

field.name: WP
field.description: Write protect: 0:Protection disabled 1:Protection enabled All areas are write-protected, except for 0x0030.

field.name: PR
field.description: Progress of the reset procedure: 00:initial/reset state 01:after writing 0x52 ('R'), when previous state was 00 10:after writing 0x45 ('E'), when previous state was 01 11:after writing 0x53 ('S'), when previous state was 10. This value must not be observed because the ESC enters reset when this state is reached, resulting in state 00

field.name: RST
field.description: A reset is asserted after writing the reset sequence 0x52 ('R'), 0x45 ('E') and 0x53 ('S') in this register with 3 consecutive commands. Any other command which does not continue the sequence by writing the next expected value will cancel the reset procedure

field.name: SA
field.description: Station alias: 0:Ignore Station Alias 1:Alias can be used for all configured address comm

field.name: RFS
field.description: RX FIFO Size (ESC delays start of forwarding until FIFO is at least half full). RX FIFO Size/RX delay reduction** : Value:EBUS:MII: 0:-50 ns -40 ns (-80 ns***) 1:-40 ns -40 ns (-80 ns***) 2:-30 ns -40 ns 3:-20 ns -40 ns 4:-10 ns no change 5:no change no change 6:no change no change 7:default default NOTE:EEPROM value is only taken over at first EEPROM load after power-on or reset

field.name: LP3
field.description: Loop Port 3: 00:Auto 01:Auto Close 10:Open 11:Closed

field.name: LP2
field.description: Loop Port 2: 00:Auto 01:Auto Close 10:Open 11:Closed

field.name: LP1
field.description: Loop Port 1: 00:Auto 01:Auto Close 10:Open 11:Closed

field.name: LP0
field.description: Loop Port 0: 00:Auto 01:Auto Close 10:Open 11:Closed NOTE: Loop open means sending/receiving over this port is enabled, loop closed means sending/receiving is disabled and frames are forwarded to the next open port internally. Auto:loop closed at link down, opened at link up Auto Close:loop closed at link down, opened with writing 01 again after link up (or receiving a valid Ethernet frame at the closed port) Open:loop open regardless of link state Closed:loop closed regardless of link state

field.name: TU
field.description: Temporary use of settings in 0x0100:0x0103[8:15]: 0:permanent use 1:use for about 1 second, then revert to previous settings

field.name: FR
field.description: Forwarding rule: 0:Forward non-EtherCAT frames: EtherCAT frames are processed, non-EtherCAT frames are forwarded without processing or modification. The source MAC address is not changed for any frame. 1:Destroy non-EtherCAT frames: EtherCAT frames are processed, non-EtherCAT frames are destroyed. The source MAC address is changed by the Processing Unit for every frame (SOURCE_MAC[1] is set

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: This register is used for ReadWrite commands in Device Addressing mode (FPRW, APRW, BRW). The internal read address is directly taken from the offset address field of the EtherCAT datagram header, while the internal write address is calculated by adding the Physical Read/Write Offset value to the offset address field. Internal read address = ADR, internal write address = ADR + R/W-Offset

field.name: CP3
field.description: Communication on Port 3: 0:No stable communication 1:Communication established

field.name: LP3
field.description: Loop Port 3: 0:Open 1:Closed

field.name: CP2
field.description: Communication on Port 2: 0:No stable communication 1:Communication established

field.name: LP2
field.description: Loop Port 2: 0:Open 1:Closed

field.name: CP1
field.description: Communication on Port 1: 0:No stable communication 1:Communication established

field.name: LP1
field.description: Loop Port 1: 0:Open 1:Closed

field.name: CP0
field.description: Communication on Port 0: 0:No stable communication 1:Communication established

field.name: LP0
field.description: Loop Port 0: 0:Open 1:Closed

field.name: PLP3
field.description: Physical link on Port 3: 0:No link 1:Link detected

field.name: PLP2
field.description: Physical link on Port 2: 0:No link 1:Link detected

field.name: PLP1
field.description: Physical link on Port 1: 0:No link 1:Link detected

field.name: PLP0
field.description: Physical link on Port 0: 0:No link 1:Link detected

field.name: ELD
field.description: Enhanced Link detection: 0:Deactivated for all ports 1:Activated for at least one port NOTE:EEPROM value is only transferred into this register at first EEPROM load after power-on or reset

field.name: WDS
field.description: PDI Watchdog Status: 0:Watchdog expired 1:Watchdog reloaded

field.name: EPLC
field.description: PDI operational/EEPROM loaded correctly: 0:EEPROM not loaded, PDI not operational (no access to Process Data RAM) 1:EEPROM loaded correctly, PDI operational (access to Process Data RAM)

field.name: DI
field.description: Device Identification: 0:No request 1:Device Identification request

field.name: EIA
field.description: Error Ind Ack: 0:No Ack of Error Ind in AL status register 1:Ack of Error Ind in AL status register

field.name: IST
field.description: Initiate State Transition of the Device State Machine: 1:Request Init State 3:Request Bootstrap State 2:Request Pre-Operational State 4:Request Safe-Operational State 8:Request Operational State

field.name: DI
field.description: Device Identification: 0:Device Identification not valid 1:Device Identification loaded

field.name: EI
field.description: Error Ind: 0:Device is in State as requested or Flag cleared by command 1:Device has not entered requested State or changed State as result of a local action

field.name: AS
field.description: Actual State of the Device State Machine: 1:Init State 3:Bootstrap State 2:Pre-Operational State 4:Safe-Operational State 8:Operational State

field.name: CODE
field.description: AL Status Code

field.name: EN_OVRD
field.description: Enable Override: 0:Override disabled 1:Override enabled

field.name: LED_CODE
field.description: LED code: 0x0:Off 0x1:Flash 1x 0x2-0xC:Flash 2x 12x 0xD:Blinking 0xE:Flickering 0xF:On

field.name: EN_OVRD
field.description: Enable Override: 0:Override disabled 1:Override enabled

field.name: LED_CODE
field.description: LED code: 0x0:Off 0x1-0xC:Flash 1x 12x 0xD:Blinking 0xE:Flickering 0xF:On

field.name: PDI
field.description: Process data interface: 0x00:Interface deactivated (no PDI) 0x01:4 Digital Input 0x02:4 Digital Output 0x03:2 Digital Input and 2 Digital Output 0x04:Digital I/O 0x05:SPI Slave 0x06:Oversampling I/O 0x07:EtherCAT Bridge (port 3) 0x08:16 Bit asynchronous Microcontroller interface 0x09:8 Bit asynchronous Microcontroller interface 0x0A:16 Bit synchronous Microcontroller interface 0x0B:8 Bit synchronous Microcontroller interface 0x10:32 Digital Input and 0 Digital Output 0x11:24 Digital Input and 8 Digital Output 0x12:16 Digital Input and 16 Digital Output 0x13:8 Digital Input and 24 Digital Output 0x14:0 Digital Input and 32 Digital Output 0x80:On-chip bus Others:Reserved

field.name: ELP3
field.description: Enhanced Link port 3: 0:disabled (if bit 1=0) 1:enabled

field.name: ELP2
field.description: Enhanced Link port 2: 0:disabled (if bit 1=0) 1:enabled

field.name: ELP1
field.description: Enhanced Link port 1: 0:disabled (if bit 1=0) 1:enabled

field.name: ELP0
field.description: Enhanced Link port 0: 0:disabled (if bit 1=0) 1:enabled

field.name: CDLIU
field.description: Distributed Clocks Latch In Unit: 0:disabled (power saving) 1:enabled

field.name: DCSOU
field.description: Distributed Clocks SYNC Out Unit: 0:disabled (power saving) 1:enabled

field.name: ELDAP
field.description: Enhanced Link detection all ports: 0:disabled (if bits [7:4]=0) 1:enabled at all ports (overrides bits [7:4])

field.name: DEV_EMU
field.description: Device emulation (control of AL status): 0:AL status register has to be set by PDI 1:AL status register will be set to value written to AL control register

field.name: PDICN
field.description: PDI configuration invalid: 0:PDI configuration ok 1:PDI configuration invalid

field.name: PDIA
field.description: PDI active: 0:PDI not active 1:PDI active

field.name: ECLFE
field.description: ESC configuration area loaded from EEPROM: 0:not loaded 1:loaded

field.name: PFABW
field.description: DI function acknowledge by write: 0:Disabled 1:Enabled

field.name: BUS
field.description: On-chip bus: 000:Intel Avalon 001:AXI 010:Xilinx PLB v4.6 100:Xilinx OPB others:reserved

field.name: CLK
field.description: On-chip bus clock: 0:asynchronous 1-31:synchronous multiplication factor (N * 25 MHz)

field.name: SYNC1_MAER
field.description: SYNC1 mapped to AL Event Request register 0x0220[3]: 0:Disabled 1:Enabled

field.name: SYNC1_CFG
field.description: SYNC1/LATCH1 configuration*: 0:LATCH1 input 1:SYNC1 output

field.name: SYNC1_ODP
field.description: SYNC1 output driver/polarity: 00:Push-Pull active low 01:Open Drain (active low) 10:Push-Pull active high 11:Open Source (active high)

field.name: SYNC0_MAER
field.description: SYNC0 mapped to AL Event Request register 0x0220[2]: 0:Disabled 1:Enabled

field.name: SYNC0_CFG
field.description: SYNC0/LATCH0 configuration*: 0:LATCH0 Input 1:SYNC0 Output

field.name: SYNC0_ODP
field.description: SYNC0 output driver/polarity: 00:Push-Pull active low 01:Open Drain (active low) 10:Push-Pull active high 11:Open Source (active high)

field.name: OCBST
field.description: On-chip bus sub-type for AXI: 000:AXI3 001:AXI4 010:AXI4 LITE others:reserved

field.name: RPS
field.description: Read prefetch size (in cycles of PDI width): 0:4 cycles 1:1 cycle (typical) 2:2 cycles 3:Reserved

field.name: MASK
field.description: ECAT Event masking of the ECAT Event Request Events for mapping into ECAT event field of EtherCAT frames: 0:Corresponding ECAT Event Request register bit is not mapped 1:Corresponding ECAT Event Request register bit is mapped

field.name: MASK
field.description: AL Event masking of the AL Event Request register Events for mapping to PDI IRQ signal: 0:Corresponding AL Event Request register bit is not mapped 1:Corresponding AL Event Request register bit is mapped

field.name: MV
field.description:
Mirrors values of each SyncManager Status: 0:No Sync Channel 0 event 1:Sync Channel 0 event pending 0:No Sync Channel 1 event 1:Sync Channel 1 event pending
0:No Sync Channel 7 event 1:Sync Channel 7 event pending

field.name: ALS_EVT
field.description: AL Status event: 0:No change in AL Status 1:AL Status change (Bit is cleared by reading out AL Status 0x0130:0x0131 from ECAT)

field.name: DLS_EVT
field.description: DL Status event: 0:No change in DL Status 1:DL Status change (Bit is cleared by reading out DL Status 0x0110:0x0111 from ECAT)

field.name: DCL_EVT
field.description: DC Latch event: 0:No change on DC Latch Inputs 1:At least one change on DC Latch Inputs (Bit is cleared by reading DC Latch event times from ECAT for ECAT-controlled Latch Units, so that Latch 0/1 Status 0x09AE:0x09AF indicates no event)

field.name: SM_INT
field.description:
SyncManager interrupts (SyncManager register offset 0x5, bit [0] or [1]): 0:No SyncManager 0 interrupt 1:SyncManager 0 interrupt pending 0:No SyncManager 1 interrupt 1:SyncManager 1 interrupt pending
0:No SyncManager 15 interrupt 1:SyncManager 15 interrupt pending

field.name: WDG_PD
field.description: Watchdog Process Data: 0:Has not expired 1:Has expired (Bit is cleared by reading Watchdog Status Process Data 0x0440 from PDI)

field.name: EE_EMU
field.description: EEPROM Emulation: 0:No command pending 1:EEPROM command pending (Bit is cleared by acknowledging the command in EEPROM Control/Status register 0x0502:0x0503[10:8] from PDI)

field.name: SM_ACT
field.description: SyncManager activation register (SyncManager register offset 0x6) changed: 0:No change in any SyncManager 1:At least one SyncManager changed (Bit is cleared by reading SyncManager Activation registers 0x0806 etc. from PDI)

field.name: ST_DC_SYNC1
field.description: State of DC SYNC1 (if register 0x0151[7]=1): (Bit is cleared by reading of SYNC1 status 0x098F from PDI, use only in Acknowledge mode)

field.name: ST_DC_SYNC0
field.description: State of DC SYNC0 (if register 0x0151[3]=1): (Bit is cleared by reading SYNC0 status 0x098E from PDI, use only in Acknowledge mode)

field.name: DCL_EVT
field.description: DC Latch event: 0:No change on DC Latch Inputs 1:At least one change on DC Latch Inputs (Bit is cleared by reading DC Latch event times from PDI, so that Latch 0/1 Status 0x09AE:0x09AF indicates no event. Available if Latch Unit is PDI-controlled)

field.name: ALC_EVT
field.description: AL Control event: 0:No AL Control Register change 1:AL Control Register has been written3 (Bit is cleared by reading AL Control register 0x0120:0x0121 from PDI)

field.name: RX_ERR
field.description: RX Error counter of Port y (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached).

field.name: IVD_FRM
field.description: Invalid frame counter of Port y (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached).

field.name: ERR_CNT
field.description: Forwarded error counter of Port y (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached).

field.name: CNT
field.description: ECAT Processing Unit error counter (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached). Counts errors of frames passing the Processing Unit.

field.name: CNT
field.description: PDI Error counter (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached). Counts if a PDI access has an interface error.

field.name: CNT
field.description: Lost Link counter of Port y (counting is stopped when 0xff is reached). Counts only if port is open and loop is Auto.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Watchdog divider:Number of 25 MHz tics (minus 2) that represent the basic watchdog increment. (Default value is 100s = 2498)

field.name: TIME
field.description: Watchdog Time PDI:number of basic watchdog increments (Default value with Watchdog divider 100s means 100ms Watchdog)

field.name: TIME
field.description: Watchdog Time Process Data:number of basic watchdog increments (Default value with Watchdog divider 100s means 100ms Watchdog)

field.name: ST
field.description: Watchdog Status of Process Data (triggered by SyncManagers) 0:Watchdog Process Data expired 1:Watchdog Process Data is active or disabled

field.name: CNT
field.description: Watchdog Counter Process Data (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached). Counts if Process Data Watchdog expires.

field.name: CNT
field.description: Watchdog PDI counter (counting is stopped when 0xFF is reached). Counts if PDI Watchdog expires.

field.name: FORCE_ECAT
field.description: Force ECAT access: 0:Do not change Bit 0x0501[0] 1:Reset Bit 0x0501[0] to 0

field.name: PDI
field.description: EEPROM control is offered to PDI: 0:no 1:yes (PDI has EEPROM control)

field.name: ACCESS
field.description: Access to EEPROM: 0:PDI releases EEPROM access 1:PDI takes EEPROM access (PDI has EEPROM control)

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy: 0:EEPROM Interface is idle 1:EEPROM Interface is busy

field.name: ERR_WEN
field.description: Error Write Enable*3 : 0:No error 1:Write Command without Write enable

field.name: ERR_ACK_CMD
field.description: Error Acknowledge/Command*3 : 0:No error 1:Missing EEPROM acknowledge or invalid command EEPROM emulation only:PDI writes 1 if a temporary failure has occurred.

field.name: EE_LDS
field.description: EEPROM loading status: 0:EEPROM loaded, device information ok 1:EEPROM not loaded, device information not available (EEPROM loading in progress or finished with a failure)

field.name: CKSM_ERR
field.description: Checksum Error in ESC Configuration Area: 0:Checksum ok 1:Checksum error EEPROM emulation for IP Core only:PDI writes 1 if a CRC failure has occurred for a reload command.

field.name: CMD
field.description: Command register*2: Write:Initiate command. Read:Currently executed command Commands: 000:No command/EEPROM idle (clear error bits) 001:Read 010:Write 100:Reload Others:Reserved/invalid commands (do not issue) EEPROM emulation only:after execution, PDI writes command value to indicate operation is ready.

field.name: EE_ALGM
field.description: Selected EEPROM Algorithm: 0:1 address byte (1Kbit 16Kbit EEPROMs) 1:2 address bytes (32Kbit 4 Mbit EEPROMs)

field.name: NUM_RD_BYTE
field.description: Supported number of EEPROM read bytes: 0:4 Bytes 1:8 Bytes

field.name: EE_EMU
field.description: EPROM emulation: 0:Normal operation (IC interface used) 1:PDI emulates EEPROM (IC not used)

field.name: ECAT_WEN
field.description: ECAT write enable*2 : 0:Write requests are disabled 1:Write requests are enabled This bit is always 1 if PDI has EEPROM control.

field.name: ADDR
field.description:
EEPROM Address 0:First word (= 16 bit) 1:Second word
Actually used EEPROM Address bits: [9-0] : EEPROM size up to 16 Kbit [17-0] : EEPROM size 32 Kbit 4 Mbit [31-0] : EEPROM Emulation

field.name: HI
field.description: EEPROM Read data (data read from EEPROM, higher bytes)

field.name: LO
field.description: EEPROM Write data (data to be written to EEPROM) or EEPROM Read data (data read from EEPROM, lower bytes)

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Busy: 0:MII Management Interface is idle 1:MII Management Interface is busy

field.name: CMD_ERR
field.description: Command error: 0:Last Command was successful 1:Invalid command or write command without Write Enable Cleared by executing a valid command or by writing 00 to Command register bits [9:8].

field.name: RD_ERR
field.description: Read error: 0:No read error 1:Read error occurred (PHY or register not available) Cleared by writing to register 0x0511

field.name: CMD
field.description: Command register*: Write:Initiate command. Read:Currently executed command 00:No command/MI idle (clear error bits) 01:Read 10:Write Others:Reserved/invalid command (do not issue)

field.name: PHY_ADDR
field.description: PHY address of port 0 (this is equal to the PHY address offset, if the PHY addresses are consecutive) IP Core since V3.0.0/3.00c: Translation 0x0512[7]=0: Register 0x0510[7:3] shows PHY address of port 0 Translation 0x0512[7]=1: Register 0x0510[7:3] shows the PHY address which will be used for port 0-3 as requested by 0x0512[4:0] (valid values 0-3)

field.name: LINK_DC
field.description: MI link detection and configuration: 0:Disabled for all ports 1:Enabled for at least one MII port, refer to PHY Port Status (0x0518 ff.) for details

field.name: PDI
field.description: Management Interface can be controlled by PDI (registers 0x0516-0x0517): 0:Only ECAT control 1:PDI control possible

field.name: WEN
field.description: Write enable*: 0:Write disabled 1:Write enabled This bit is always 1 if PDI has MI control. ET1100-0000/-0001 exception: Bit is not always 1 if PDI has MI control, and bit is writable by PDI.

field.name: SHOW
field.description: Target PHY Address translation: 0:Enabled 1:Disabled Refer to 0x0512[4:0] and 0x0510[7:3] for details.

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Target PHY Address Translation 0x0512[7]=0: 0-3:Target PHY Addresses 0-3 are used to access the PHYs at port 0-3, when the PHY addresses are properly configured 4-31:The configured PHY address of port 0 (PHY address offset) is added to the Target PHY Address values 4-31 when accessing a PHY Translation 0x0512[7]=1: 0-31:Target PHY Addresses is used when accessing a PHY without translation

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Address of PHY Register that shall be read/written

field.name: DATA
field.description: PHY Read/Write Data

field.name: ACC
field.description: Access to MII management: 0:ECAT enables PDI takeover of MII management interface 1:ECAT claims exclusive access to MII management interface

field.name: FORCE
field.description: Force PDI Access State: 0:Do not change Bit 0x0517[0] 1:Reset Bit 0x0517[0] to 0

field.name: ACC
field.description: Access to MII management: 0:ECAT has access to MII management 1:PDI has access to MII management

field.name: PCU
field.description: PHY configuration updated: 0:No update 1:PHY configuration was updated Cleared by writing any value to at least one of the PHY Port y Status registers.

field.name: LPE
field.description: Link partner error: 0:No error detected 1:Link partner error

field.name: RE
field.description: Read error: 0:No read error occurred 1:A read error has occurred Cleared by writing any value to at least one of the PHY Port y Status registers.

field.name: LSE
field.description: Link status error: 0:No error 1:Link error, link inhibited

field.name: LS
field.description: Link status (100 Mbit/s, Full Duplex, Auto negotiation): 0:No link 1:Link detected

field.name: PLS
field.description: Physical link status (PHY status register 1.2): 0:No physical link 1:Physical link detected

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Logical start address within the EtherCAT Address Space.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Offset from the first logical FMMU byte to the last FMMU byte + 1 (e.g., if two bytes are used, then this parameter shall contain 2)

field.name: START
field.description: Logical starting bit that shall be mapped (bits are counted from least significant bit 0 to most significant bit 7)

field.name: STOP
field.description: Last logical bit that shall be mapped (bits are counted from least significant bit 0 to most significant bit 7)

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Physical Start Address (mapped to logical Start address)

field.name: START
field.description: Physical starting bit as target of logical start bit mapping (bits are counted from least significant bit 0 to most significant bit 7)

field.name: MAP_WR
field.description: 0:Ignore mapping for write accesses 1:Use mapping for write accesses

field.name: MAP_RD
field.description: 0:Ignore mapping for read accesses 1:Use mapping for read accesses

field.name: ACT
field.description: 0:FMMU deactivated 1:FMMU activated. FMMU checks logically addressed blocks to be mapped according to configured mapping

field.name: ADDR
field.description: First byte that will be handled by SyncManager

field.name: LEN
field.description: Number of bytes assigned to SyncManager (shall be greater than 1, otherwise SyncManager is not activated. If set to 1, only Watchdog Trigger is generated if configured)

field.name: WDG_TRG_EN
field.description: Watchdog Trigger Enable: 0:Disabled 1:Enabled

field.name: INT_AL
field.description: Interrupt in AL Event Request Register: 0:Disabled 1:Enabled

field.name: INT_ECAT
field.description: Interrupt in ECAT Event Request Register: 0:Disabled 1:Enabled

field.name: DIR
field.description: Direction: 00:Read:ECAT read access, PDI write access. 01:Write:ECAT write access, PDI read access. 10:Reserved 11:Reserved

field.name: OP_MODE
field.description: Operation Mode: 00:Buffered (3 buffer mode) 01:Reserved 10:Mailbox (Single buffer mode) 11:Reserved

field.name: WB_INUSE
field.description: Write buffer in use (opened)

field.name: RB_INUSE
field.description: Read buffer in use (opened)

field.name: BUF_MODE
field.description: Buffered mode:buffer status (last written buffer): 00:1 st buffer 01:2 nd buffer 10:3 rd buffer 11:(no buffer written) Mailbox mode:reserved

field.name: MBX_MODE
field.description: Mailbox mode:mailbox status: 0:Mailbox empty 1:Mailbox full Buffered mode:reserved

field.name: INT_RD
field.description: Interrupt Read: 1:Interrupt after buffer was completely and successfully read 0:Interrupt cleared after first byte of buffer was written NOTE:This interrupt is signalled to the writing side if enabled in the SM Control register

field.name: INT_WR
field.description: Interrupt Write: 1:Interrupt after buffer was completely and successfully written 0:Interrupt cleared after first byte of buffer was read NOTE:This interrupt is signalled to the reading side if enabled in the SM Control register

field.name: LATCH_PDI
field.description: Latch Event PDI: 0:No 1:Generate Latch events when PDI issues a buffer exchange or when PDI accesses buffer start address

field.name: LATCH_ECAT
field.description: Latch Event ECAT: 0:No 1:Generate Latch event when EtherCAT master issues a buffer exchange

field.name: REPEAT
field.description: Repeat Request: A toggle of Repeat Request means that a mailbox retry is needed (primarily used in conjunction with ECAT Read Mailbox)

field.name: EN
field.description: SyncManager Enable/Disable: 0:Disable:Access to Memory without SyncManager control 1:Enable:SyncManager is active and controls Memory area set in configuration

field.name: REPEAT_ACK
field.description: Repeat Ack: If this is set to the same value as that set by Repeat Request, the PDI acknowledges the execution of a previous set Repeat request.

field.name: DEACT
field.description: Deactivate SyncManager: Read: 0:Normal operation, SyncManager activated. 1:SyncManager deactivated and reset. SyncManager locks access to Memory area. Write: 0:Activate SyncManager 1:Request SyncManager deactivation NOTE:Writing 1 is delayed until the end of the frame, which is currently processed.

field.name: LT
field.description: Local time at the beginning of the last receive frame containing a write access to register 0x0900.

field.name: REQ
field.description: Write: A write access to register 0x0900 with BWR or FPWR latches the local time at the beginning of the receive frame (start first bit of preamble) at each port. Write (ESC20, ET1200 exception): A write access latches the local time at the beginning of the receive frame at port 0. It enables the time stamping at the other ports. Read: Local time at the beginning of the last receive frame containing a write access to this register. NOTE:FPWR requires an address match for accessing this register like any FPWR command. All write commands with address match will increment the working counter (e.g., APWR), but they will not trigger receive time latching.

field.name: ST
field.description: No description available

field.name: LT
field.description: Local time at the beginning of a frame (start first bit of preamble) received at the ECAT Processing Unit containing a write access to register 0x0900 NOTE:E.g., if port 0 is open, this register reflects the Receive Time Port 0 as a 64 Bit value. Any valid EtherCAT write access to register 0x0900 triggers latching, not only BWR/FPWR commands as with register 0x0900.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Difference between local time and System Time. Offset is added to the local time.

field.name: DLY
field.description: Delay between Reference Clock and the ESC

field.name: DIFF
field.description: 0:Local copy of System Time less than received System Time 1:Local copy of System Time greater than or equal to received System Time

field.name: NUM
field.description: Mean difference between local copy of System Time and received System Time values Difference = Received System Time local copy of System Time

field.name: BW
field.description: Bandwidth for adjustment of local copy of System Time (larger values smaller bandwidth and smoother adjustment) A write access resets System Time Difference (0x092C:0x092F) and Speed Counter Diff (0x0932:0x0933). Valid values:0x0080 to 0x3FFF

field.name: DIFF
field.description: Representation of the deviation between local clock period and Reference Clock's clock period (representation:two's complement) Range:(Speed Counter Start 0x7F)

field.name: DEPTH
field.description: Filter depth for averaging the received System Time deviation IP Core since V2.2.0/V2.02a: A write access resets System Time Difference (0x092C:0x092F)

field.name: DEPTH
field.description: Filter depth for averaging the clock period deviation IP Core since V2.2.0/V2.02a: A write access resets the internal speed counter filter

field.name: LATCH_MODE
field.description: Receive Time Latch Mode: 0:Forwarding mode (used if frames are entering the ESC at port 0 first): Receive time stamps of ports 1-3 are enabled after the write access to 0x0900, so the following frame at ports 1-3 will be time stamped (this is typically the write frame to 0x0900 coming back from the network behind the ESC). 1:Reverse mode (used if frames are entering ESC at port 1-3 first): Receive time stamps of ports 1-3 are immediately taken over from the internal hidden time stamp registers, so the previous frame entering the ESC at ports 1-3 will be time stamped when the write frame to 0x0900 enters port 0 (the previous frame at ports 1-3 is typically the write frame to 0x0900 coming from the master, which will enable time stamp

field.name: LATCHI1
field.description: Latch In unit 1: 0:ECAT-controlled 1:PDI-controlled NOTE:Latch interrupt is routed to ECAT/PDI depending on this setting

field.name: LATCHI0
field.description: Latch In unit 0: 0:ECAT-controlled 1:PDI-controlled NOTE:Latch interrupt is routed to ECAT/PDI depending on this setting. Always 1 (PDI-controlled) if System Time is PDIcontrolled.

field.name: SYNCO
field.description: Cyclic Unit and SYNC0 out unit control: 0:ECAT-controlled 1:PDI-controlled

field.name: SSDP
field.description: SyncSignal debug pulse (Vasily bit): 0:Deactivated 1:Immediately generate one ping only on SYNC0-1 according to 0x0981[2:1 for debugging This bit is self-clearing, always read 0. All pulses are generated at the same time, the cycle time is ignored. The configured pulse length is used.

field.name: NFC
field.description: Near future configuration (approx.): 0: DC width future (231 ns or 263 ns) 1:~2.1 sec. future (231 ns)

field.name: STPC
field.description: Start Time plausibility check: 0:Disabled. SyncSignal generation if Start Time is reached. 1:Immediate SyncSignal generation if Start Time is outside near future (see 0x0981[6])

field.name: EXT
field.description: Extension of Start Time Cyclic Operation (0x0990:0x0993): 0:No extension 1:Extend 32 bit written Start Time to 64 bit

field.name: AC
field.description: Auto-activation by writing Start Time Cyclic Operation (0x0990:0x0997): 0:Disabled 1:Auto-activation enabled. 0x0981[0] is set automatically after Start Time is written.

field.name: SYNC1_GEN
field.description: SYNC1 generation: 0:Deactivated 1:SYNC1 pulse is generated

field.name: SYNC0_GEN
field.description: SYNC0 generation: 0:Deactivated 1:SYNC0 pulse is generated

field.name: SOUA
field.description: Sync Out Unit activation: 0:Deactivated 1:Activated

field.name: LEN
field.description: Pulse length of SyncSignals (in Units of 10ns) 0:Acknowledge mode:SyncSignal will be cleared by reading SYNC[1:0] Status register

field.name: CHK_RSLT
field.description: Start Time Cyclic Operation (0x0990:0x0997) plausibility check result when Sync Out Unit was activated: 0:Start Time was within near future 1:Start Time was out of near future (0x0981[6])

field.name: SYNC1
field.description: SYNC1 activation state: 0:First SYNC1 pulse is not pending 1:First SYNC1 pulse is pending

field.name: SYNC0
field.description: SYNC0 activation state: 0:First SYNC0 pulse is not pending 1:First SYNC0 pulse is pending

field.name: ACK
field.description: SYNC0 state for Acknowledge mode. SYNC0 in Acknowledge mode is cleared by reading this register from PDI, use only in Acknowledge mode

field.name: ACK
field.description: SYNC1 state for Acknowledge mode. SYNC1 in Acknowledge mode is cleared by reading this register from PDI, use only in Acknowledge mode

field.name: ST
field.description: Write:Start time (System time) of cyclic operation in ns Read:System time of next SYNC0 pulse in ns

field.name: TIME
field.description: System time of next SYNC1 pulse in ns

field.name: CYC
field.description: Time between two consecutive SYNC0 pulses in ns. 0:Single shot mode, generate only one SYNC0 pulse.

field.name: CYC
field.description: Time between SYNC0 pulse and SYNC1 pulse in ns

field.name: NEG_EDGE
field.description: Latch0 negative edge: 0:Continuous Latch active 1:Single event (only first event active)

field.name: POS_EDGE
field.description: Latch0 positive edge: 0:Continuous Latch active 1:Single event (only first event active)

field.name: NEG_EDGE
field.description: Latch1 negative edge: 0:Continuous Latch active 1:Single event (only first event active)

field.name: POS_EDGE
field.description: Latch1 positive edge: 0:Continuous Latch active 1:Single event (only first event active)

field.name: PIN_STAT
field.description: Latch0 pin state

field.name: NEG_EDGE
field.description: Event Latch0 negative edge. 0:Negative edge not detected or continuous mode 1:Negative edge detected in single event mode only. Flag cleared by reading out Latch0 Time Negative Edge.

field.name: POS_EDGE
field.description: Event Latch0 positive edge. 0:Positive edge not detected or continuous mode 1:Positive edge detected in single event mode only. Flag cleared by reading out Latch0 Time Positive Edge.

field.name: PIN_STAT
field.description: Latch1 pin state

field.name: NEG_EDGE
field.description: Event Latch1 negative edge. 0:Negative edge not detected or continuous mode 1:Negative edge detected in single event mode only. Flag cleared by reading out Latch1 Time Negative Edge.

field.name: POS_EDGE
field.description: Event Latch1 positive edge. 0:Positive edge not detected or continuous mode 1:Positive edge detected in single event mode only. Flag cleared by reading out Latch1 Time Positive Edge.

field.name: TIME
field.description: System time at the positive edge of the Latch0 signal.

field.name: TIME
field.description: System time at the negative edge of the Latch0 signal.

field.name: TIME
field.description: System time at the positive edge of the Latch1 signal.

field.name: TIME
field.description: System time at the negative edge of the Latch1 signal.

field.name: TIME
field.description: Local time at the beginning of the frame which causes at least one SyncManager to assert an ECAT event

field.name: TIME
field.description: Local time when at least one SyncManager asserts a PDI buffer start event

field.name: TIME
field.description: Local time when at least one SyncManager asserts a PDI buffer change event

field.name: PID
field.description: Product ID

field.name: VID
field.description: Vendor ID: [23-0] Company [31-24] Department NOTE:Test Vendor IDs have [31:28]=0xE

field.name: OD
field.description: Output Data

field.name: GPOD
field.description: General Purpose Output Data

field.name: GPID
field.description: General Purpose Input Data

field.name: EXTF
field.description: Number of extended feature bits

field.name: PRWO
field.description: Physical Read/Write Offset (0x0108:0x0109)

field.name: AEMW
field.description: AL Event Mask writable (0x0204:0x0207)

field.name: GPO
field.description: General Purpose Outputs (0x0F10:0x0F17)

field.name: GPI
field.description: General Purpose Inputs (0x0F18:0x0F1F)

field.name: CSA
field.description: Configured Station Alias (0x0012:0x0013)

field.name: EIM
field.description: ECAT Interrupt Mask (0x0200:0x0201)

field.name: ALSCR
field.description: AL Status Code Register (0x0134:0x0135)

field.name: EDLCR
field.description: Extended DL Control Register (0x0102:0x0103)

field.name: ESCFG
field.description: EEPROM Size configurable (0x0502[7]): 0:EEPROM Size fixed to sizes up to 16 Kbit 1:EEPROM Size configurable

field.name: EPUPEC
field.description: ECAT Processing Unit/PDI Error Counter (0x030C:0x030D)

field.name: DCSMET
field.description: DC SyncManager Event Times (0x09F0:0x09FF)

field.name: WP
field.description: Write Protection (0x0020:0x0031)

field.name: WDGCNT
field.description: Watchdog counters (0x0442:0x0443)

field.name: WDW
field.description: Watchdog divider writable (0x0400:0x0401) and Watchdog PDI (0x0410:0x0411)

field.name: RLED
field.description: Run LED (DEV_STATE LED)

field.name: ELDE
field.description: Enhanced Link Detection EBUS

field.name: ELDM
field.description: Enhanced Link Detection MII

field.name: MMI
field.description: MII Management Interface (0x0510:0x0515)

field.name: LLC
field.description: Lost Link Counter (0x0310:0x0313)

field.name: LDCM
field.description: Link detection and configuration by MI

field.name: DTLC
field.description: DC Time loop control assigned to PDI

field.name: DSOU
field.description: DC Sync Out Unit

field.name: DLIU
field.description: DC Latch In Unit

field.name: LALED
field.description: Link/Activity LED

field.name: DDIOR
field.description: Disable Digital I/O register (0x0F00:0x0F03)

field.name: EEU
field.description: EEPROM emulation by Controller

field.name: ATS
field.description: Automatic TX shift

field.name: MCPP
field.description: MI control by PDI possible

field.name: RELEDOR
field.description: RUN/ERR LED Override (0x0138:0x0139)

field.name: DCST
field.description: DC System Time (0x0910:0x0936)

field.name: DCRT
field.description: DC Receive Times (0x0900:0x090F)

field.name: DCS1D
field.description: DC Sync1 disable

field.name: PPDI
field.description: PLB PDI

field.name: OPDI
field.description: OPB PDI

field.name: APDI
field.description: Avalon PDI

field.name: PDICEC
field.description: PDI clears error counter

field.name: DC64
field.description: DC 64 bit

field.name: DR
